head_text.subj: DEEP BLUE WATER FILLS THE FRAME.

text: And there... a few feet beneath the surface... something SHIMMERS in the sunlight. As ripples dissipate, we make o the shape of a bright yellow CRANKBAIT waiting patiently its prey on the end of a 10-pound line. We hold on this for another silent beat... then -- a huge BLACK BASS suddenly swoops into frame, circling the bait!
Both startle at the sight. Kale, a clean-cut all-American kid, reflexively yanks back on his rod and reel.
Whoa, did you see that thing? Kale anxiously winds the spool --
Settle down, slow it down... Jeff lightly puts his hand on Kale's, slowing the crankin to a slight, steady pull as we WIDEN TO REVEAL them stand near the stern of their 16-foot BASSMASTER. We are...

The undisturbed beauty of nature serves as our backdrop a we MOVE CLOSER to Kale and Jeff, taking note of their t- shirts: Jeff's has a silkscreened cartoon rendition of a Bass wearing aviator goggles with mounted missiles on its fins. Beneath it, the slogan: "Weapons of Bass Destructio The fish on Kale's shirt wears a stock car uniform, a sin word across the bottom: BASSCAR. As Jeff steadies Kale's hand and pulls away:
You don't want to scare him off. You've got his attention, now just play with him. Tease him a little.
Kale and Jeff watch the water in anxious silence... Kale inching the line back toward the boat. One more crank, th The BLACK BASS suddenly ATTACKS THE LURE with a tremendou
Holy shit!
It's all you, Kale, keep cranking! Kale cranks fast and furious.    But this is one fish tha going down fighting.
I need reinforcements! Jeff moves in, grabs the rod and reel from behind Kale.
Heave, laddie! They PULL.    The rod curls under the weight.
(pirate accent)
Give it all ya got, mate, or you're gonna lose him!
(laughing; pulling; struggling)
Dad, your pirate -- impersonation -- sucks!!
How would ya know, have ya ever met one? I doubt it -- The BASS SLOSHES FURIOUSLY around the bait, now just a fe feet from the boat!
He's freakin' pulling us in!
(laughing)
Never! No Brecht has ever -- lost a fight -- to a fish! The BASS suddenly snaps free. The line goes limp. Jeff an Kale lose their balance, nearly falling backward. Then --

All becomes silent save for Jeff and Kale's heavy breathi Kale winds the empty line back to the boat, shoots a glan to Jeff, then throws the rod aside in mock disgust. Jeff takes a seat in the captain's chair.
Throw me a -- Kale is already in the cooler. He throws Jeff a Coke. sit in silence for a beat. Then --
Hey, at least the weather's great... we're spending quality time together.
(grabbing pole)
That fish is going down.
(not missing a beat)
Let's nab the bastard. They both cast their lines --
An amber glow sets the mountainside ablaze as Jeff's SUV winds through the serpentine pass.
Jeff drives.    Kale's on his cell: KALE (cont'd) (into phone as needed)
Hey mom, it's us. Listen, fire up the grill 'cause the Bassmasters are headed home! Jeff slaps Kale five as he veers the SUV into the left la passing a slow-moving PATHFINDER...
Kale's attractive mom, JULIE, 40, on cordless, preps dinn
You're kidding. So I can actually put the burgers away this time?
Yes, be gone with the red meat!
Julie smiles.    Jeff grabs the phone from Kale.
(into phone as needed)
We're having fish for a week. Kale smiles as a LINCOLN NAVIGATOR PICK-UP zooms past in right lane, swerves back in the left lane in front of the
(over the above)
I'd say an hour. Love you, too. Jeff flips the phone shut, tosses it to Kale. They exchan smiles. A silent moment passes. They both turn to face th road as --
suddenly SWERVES back into the right lane, revealing a
directly in front of them!
Jeff instinctively reaches his arm in front of Kale as he SWINGS the wheel hard right and SLAMS ON THE BRAKES. But it's not in time. The
clips the mini-van's right rear bumper, SMASHING it into left lane concrete barricade. The SUV spins into the righ lane where that
suddenly BROADSIDES IT with such FORCE that it FLIPS the up and over. It TUMBLES off the highway, barreling into..
A couple of final, METAL-CRUNCHING FLIPS send the SUV's undercarriage CRASHING to a violent stop on top of a rick wood beam-mounted GUARDRAIL. A silent beat.    Then -- steam billows from the hood...
Airbags deflate. Dust settles. Blood streams from Jeff's hairline. His eyes flutter open.
He looks up to Kale, strapped in the passenger seat, unconscious. A small gash on his forehead. We only see blue sky through Kale's shattered passenger window.
Kale?   -- Kale, are you okay? Kale opens his eyes.       Jeff reaches up, touches Kale'

I think so. Kale looks down at his dad -- his eyes widen in horror, n only at the sight of Jeff, but of the ravine beneath them For this brief moment, we may have thought the SUV was st But we CRANE BACK UP AND OUT KALE'S PASSENGER WINDOW to R A MUCH GRIMMER REALITY: the SUV is PERCHED LENGTHWISE ON OF THE GUARDRAIL AT A 45-DEGREE DOWNWARD ANGLE. The SUV's right front and rear tires precariously grip th rail, keeping it from plunging 500 feet to the RAVINE bel
Oh my God, dad -- -- Jeff's leg is trapped beneath the crumpled dashboard.

I'm fine. But you're gonna have to climb out, Kale. Can you do that? Kale's hands shake from the SHOCK as his fingers search f the seatbelt buckle. But the shoulder strap is LOCKED IN PLACE, preventing Kale from turning. He tugs it furiously
I can't -- It won't give --
That's okay, I've got it -- grab the door, I don't need your ass falling on my face -- Kale reaches up, grips the outside of the door as
shakily reaches to Kale's seatbelt buckle and presses. Ka belt SNAPS LOOSE. Kale's body DROPS, but he hangs on to t window -- just as a

head_text.subj: GUARDRAIL BEAM SNAPS LOOSE FROM ITS FOUNDATION

text: The SUV ROCKS VIOLENTLY as the guardrail starts to bend a peel away from the cliffside under the SUV's weight.
reaches up, grabs Kale's legs and pushes, helping Kale cl out the window.
slowly slides down the outside of the door, then turns ar on his chest, reaches his hand back down to Jeff --
Dad, here -- Jeff reaches up as a
a few inches behind the SUV's rear bumper suddenly POP LO

KALE SCREAMS, hangs on for dear life as the GUARDRAIL and SUV SWING OUT AND OVER THE RAVINE. The guardrail is buckling fast. Another beam RIPS FREE of its foundation -- Kale slides a few more inches down the door and right front fender allowing
to find the edge of the foundering rail underneath. at least some footing, Kale reaches back inside --
Dad, please, you can do it -- Jeff unbuckles his belt and reaches up. Kale summons his strength, grabs Jeff's wrist, pulls him up and through th passenger window just as the

Jeff's weight pulls Kale down. Kale's feet SLIP off the rail. Kale SLAMS chest down, his TORSO wrapping around th top of the rail, feet dangling... But he's still clutchin Jeff's wrist as the SUV CRASHES INTO THE RAVINE IN A MUSH CLOUD OF DUST AND DEBRIS.
slips from Kale's grasp. Kale struggles to hang on, but he's losing the battle and the balancing act. And he know it. Tears well in Kale's eyes.
Kale, you have to climb up --
No -- I'm not leaving --
Kale --
Another GUARDRAIL BEAM UPROOTS --
NO -- Dad, please, I've got you --
(with a slight smile) I know --

CU - Jeff's left hand enters frame, clasps Kale's. Anothe beat of eyes on eyes. The guardrail continues to BUCKLE. Then -- Jeff starts to PRY KALE'S HAND AWAY -- Jeff's arm RELEASES FROM KALE'S GRIP.    Kale opens his m to scream as a shrill bell RINGS!
ON THE RINGING BELL. STUDENTS disappear into their respec classrooms. As the corridor quiets down...

(prelap)                         (subtitles as needed) Este verano, despues             This summer, after visit de visitar Hawaii,               Hawaii, I will perhaps quizas visitare a mis            visit my grandparents in abuelos en Corea.                Korea.

ON RONNIE YUN, 16, a scrawny Korean kid with a knack for perfect Spanish, stands at the front giving his speech. Note: every time Ronnie says "quizas" ("perhaps") the cla giggles because it sounds a lot like "kiss-ass." The teacher, SENOR GUTIERREZ, a rotund 50, bad comb-over khakis up to his naval, stands off to the side, quickly picking up on Ronnie's excessive and increasingly dramati use of the word.

Quizas no. Quizas                Perhaps I won't. Perhaps apenas permanecere en            I'll just stay at home. el pais. Pero quizas             But perhaps my parents mis padres tomaran la            will take pity on me. compasion en mi.                   (more dramatic) (more dramatic)                Perhaps they will make my Quizas haran mi sueno            dream a reality! Perhaps una realidad! Quizas             they will take me to a me llevaran a una playa          beach on the French Rivi en la riviera francesa           so that I may gaze upon de modo que pueda mirar          the natural beauty of it sobre la belleza natural         female inhabitants. de sus habitantes femeninos... Over this, only one GIRL, MINNIE TYCO, a rail-thin BLONDE picks up on this:
(under her breath) Keep dreaming, perv.
(longingly)                    Perhaps... Thank you. Quizas... Gracias. The class laughs, claps.    Ronnie bows, heads to his sea

Gracias, Ronnie. Quizas          Thank you, Ronnie. Perha le dare una "F."                 I'll give you an "F." The class laughs again. Gutierrez shakes his head, zeros on the student behind Ronnie. Sleeping with his arms fold on his desk, a grey hoodie pulled over his head.
Senor Brecht...
Senor Gutierrez takes some chalk, flicks it at the kid. still doesn't budge. Ronnie nudges him.
Dude --
The kid stirs, raises his head. The hoodie falls away to reveal KALE. Longer, disheveled hair. The spark in his eye's been replaced with an empty haze.
So Kale, think you can stay conscious long enough to tell us your plans for the three wondrous summer months ahead?
Kale glances around. All eyes on him. He looks at Ronnie who nods in support. Kale gets up, heads to the front of the class. He pauses. Trying to focus. Then --
Este invierno --
The class chuckles.
(correcting) Verano...
Este verano -- voy a --
Que?
Kale shuts his eyes, frustrated at the interruption. Seno Gutierrez, also losing patience, steps closer to Kale.
Que usted va a hacer?                (subtitled)
I don't know, alright?    I haven't gotten that far.
Did you do the homework or not?
(no eye contact) Guess not.

(in Kale's face) You "guess" not. I don't know who you think you are or who you think you're dealing with. You can't give me a straight answer, fine, give me one good reason why I shouldn't fail you right now?
Kale CLOCKS Gutierrez.
ON SENOR GUTIERREZ - displaying a black eye, sitting next the school's PRINCIPAL and COUNSELOR in a single row of s behind the attorneys' tables.

Kale, a little more cleaned up, wearing a suit, sits betw Julie and his DEFENSE ATTORNEY. Julie, noticeably tired, glances at her son, her expressi a fusion of anger and sympathy. Kale's eyes shift her way but his head never turns. The JUDGE mulls over his notes.
Okay, Mr. Brecht...
Kale's lawyer prompts him to stand.
You're six months shy of eighteen, that means the assault-two charge you've pled guilty to carries a max of one year in juvey. With these priors, you're up to three.
The judge lets that sink in.       Kale remains silent.
But losing a parent isn't easy. Which is why I'm sentencing you to three months house arrest.
Julie closes her eyes in relief.
You can thank your counselors and lawyer later. Mr. Brecht, I just cut you a break. Don't test me.
The judge taps his gavel.

A pair of hands wrap an ELECTRONIC MONITORING      BRACEL Kale's left ankle. WIDER TO REVEAL the hands       belong case officer, JANET PARKER, 35, no-nonsense.       Kale's on the center island. Julie watches from the       b.g. As Parker clicks the bracelet's buckle into place, a GREE LED light illuminates. It's ON THE TOP EDGE OF THE BRACEL BAND so Kale can easily see it if he looks down. Next to this light is an additional RED LIGHT that isn't on.
(making final checks) Okay, you... are all set... to go nowhere. (re: the LED lights) Now, green means you're good, you're in the safe zone which covers about
a sixty-foot radius from this guy here.
Parker points to a big black box (the CENTRAL TRACKING UN on the kitchen counter.

He's like a modem. He gets a constant signal from Mr. Bracelet that he sends through your phone line to the monitoring station downtown. So they know where you are, where you've been and what you're thinkin' 25/7.
What if he accidentally goes beyond --
(anticipating; re: red light on bracelet) Red light flashes. Means you've got about ten seconds to get your butt back to green, or else --
The execution squad shows up?

And they don't bring blindfolds. It's also tamper proof and waterproof. So don't try sticking your foot in a bucket of water and hopping across the line. It won't work, and you'll look stupid. Now, I'll be checking up on you a lot. Here's my card -- You're set up to pay his incarceration fee, Ms. Brecht?
Automatic withdrawal. (to Kale) Twelve bucks every day.

(re: a booklet) Everything else is in the manual. (making her way out) Oh, except this -- House arrest might sound like a breeze, but trust me, I've seen all kinds of folks get a bit loopy before too long, some after just a day or two. So make sure you find lots of constructive things to keep yourself busy.
Kales sits in his video game chair, wearing his X-box liv headset, playing HALO 2 -- he's on the final "boss level. GUNFIRE and EXPLOSIONS BLARE over his stereo speakers.
(into headset as needed)

Hobby, you read me? I said come around my left flank and draw his fire -- damn straight I'm trying to get you smoked, you've been hiding behind my ass the whole game -- The TV SCREEN suddenly GLITCHES.

Hobby, Jet, you guys still there? The screen goes black. The XBOX LIVE LOGO APPEARS along with the words: SERVER ERROR. Kale throws the headset asi makes sure all the wires are connected. Checks the TV scr Same thing. Kale glares at the screen another beat, then gets up, wan out of his room...
Kale slowly heads down the stairs, rounds the corner into

Kale runs into Julie who wears a black blouse and slacks, the required uniform of the steakhouse she works at. She' just thrown a couple of microwave dinners on the kitchen table. She's scrambling around, eating a couple bites, gathering her things...
Dinner's on the table. I'm closing at the restaurant the next few nights. Could be some late ones, but hey... the extra tips couldn't hurt. Kale sits at the table, picks through his food.
(glancing around)
Where's my apron... apron... She heads O.S. for a beat, comes back in with her apron a purse, sets them on the counter. Eyes her watch, sits at the table, takes a couple more quick bites. Then --
You wanna talk about anything?
I got nothin'.

Y'know, when we're finally free of all this legal stuff with the accident, the other families' lawyers... there might be a little insurance money left... maybe you should go back and see Dr. Phillips?
What, so he can tell me I'm ADD, have PTSD, and severe IAD?
IAD?
(messing with bracelet) Freakin' irritated ankle disorder.
Julie can't help but crack a little smile:
Well, that one could've been avoided.

Kale looks back up. He's not smiling. Whatever chance we had of a lighter conversation panning out here quickly fizzles. Another beat, then -- Julie pushes her chair bac heads to the counter, grabs her apron and purse.
(heading out) Do the dishes. (pleading) Please?
Julie leaves. Kale glances around the kitchen.       A me dirty dishes, stacks of paper... screw that.

Kale, looking disheveled and very perplexed, now has his pulled out from the wall. He's behind it, meticulously checking and re-connecting all the wires and ethernet cab Carefully studying the manual as he goes. He blows on the Halo 2 CD, wipes it down with his sweatsh gently puts it in the tray, giving us the idea this might not be his first attempt at this.

He powers up the Xbox, grabs a controller... so far, so good... he scrolls through the screens, a little hope returning... SERVER ERROR. Kale throws a mini-fit, slams the controller to the floor Rips the controller cord out of the XBOX --

A few stray beams of sunlight pierce the blinds. Otherwis it's a tomb. Clothes strewn everywhere. We TRACK ACROSS the floor and a virtual DEBRIS FIELD of junk food bags, wrappers, Mountain Dew cans... find Kale in bed, ankle an bracelet stick out from the sheets, arm hangs over the si

Still a mess as we find Kale, hair disheveled, rummaging through the cabinets. Lots of Costco-size boxes: crackers Pringles... a HUGE BOX OF TWINKIES. Kale spots a jar of peanut butter. He grabs the nearest bowl, pulls a bottle Hershey's syrup from the fridge, pours it all into the bo He's about to throw the syrup bottle in the trash when something in the bottom of the can catches his eye. He reaches in, pulls out a bill for XBOX LIVE: SUBSCRIPTION CANCELED.

Kale lounges in on the couch watching "The Price is Right as he spoons the peanut butter from the jar, dips it in t bowl of chocolate syrup, devours it. Brings up a two-lite of Mountain Dew, takes a big swig to wash it down.
(to contestant on TV) C'mon, bid a dollar, one dollar --
I'll bid one dollar, Bob.
Kale belches as he raises his spoon, saluting the screen. Then, after a beat, a look of grave concern crosses his f
The toilet flushes O.S. Kale opens the door, leans agains the frame, spent. He stands there a beat, absorbing the silence of the house. He eyes a door at the end of the ha
CU - the doorknob. Kale's hand enters frame, slowly turns it. Click. Kale pushes. The door CREAKS open to reveal

Hardwood floor.    Ornate, cherry wood desk.     Plush le chairs. Quiet. ON THE DESK -- dad's reading glasses sit on a stack of pa next to an antique typewriter. THE WALLS -- adorned with framed, poster-size covers of D books - non-fiction, true account titles: WHISTLEBLOWER - The Inside Story of a Real Corporate Insider; THE SENATOR SHADOWS: How Eight Men Conspired to Control One. ON ANOTHER WALL -- a family portrait of Jeff, Julie, and Kale - age six; Jeff at a book signing, smiling wide... Kale takes it all in from the doorway. His feet never onc cross into the room. His eyes say everything. Loss, anger regret. He gently pulls the door shut.

Kale samples some rap clips on I-tunes.    Likes what he' hearing. ON THE SCREEN - Kale moves the cursor to "buy song." The account screen pops up. Kale types his password. After a beat, bold red letters pop up: "THE APPLE ID OR PASSWORD YOU ENTERED WAS INVALID OR INCORRECT..." Kale ty it again. Same thing. Then -- like we all do to be sure, Kale types his password at a rate of ONE KEY PER SECOND. Same thing. Kale fumes, smelling a rat.

The shades are drawn. Kale's door is closed. Find Kale looking utterly miserable, lounging in bed watching "Biki Destinations" on HD NET. Julie enters wearing a business suit and name badge emblazoned with the RE/MAX LOGO. Kale quickly changes the channel to the local news.
(heading to the window) More trash TV?
...Thirty-three year old Patricia Walsh was last seen three nights ago...
(innocently) News.

Kale points to the TV showing a photo of a smiling PATRIC WALSH, VIBRANT, FLOWING RED HAIR - "MISSING" keyed in underneath. Julie shoots him a look, then rips open the blinds. pours in. She gathers trash off the floor.
The lawyer's sending some papers over.
And your point is?
(heading O.S.) I've got two open houses, you've gotta sign for them. That's the point.
You canceled my Xbox subscription.
I-tunes, too. (then) You know what else I'm canceling?
Kale turns to Julie who suddenly drops a pile of Kale's clothes on the floor in front of him.

Maid service. (off Kale) Sorry, you're a felon. And we're broke. I can't do it all, anymore, Kale. This isn't gonna be vacation as usual. I want these washed and the kitchen cleaned by the time I get home.
That might be difficult.
Well let me make it easier.
Julie goes to the TV, UNPLUGS IT.
That's a little dramatic, isn't it? I'm just gonna plug it back --
Julie suddenly yanks a pair of scissors off Kale's desk a SNIPS THE POWER CORD IN HALF.
What are you, mental?
(a very stern tone) One more look at that kitchen and I will be.
Julie picks up her keys and briefcase, pecks Kale on the forehead, leaves.
You heard what I said about the lawyer?
Yes!
Kale furiously stuffs clothes in the washer, blindly cran the knob, presses start.
Kale SHOVELS dishes and glasses into the dishwasher, brea a couple as he goes. He pours half the box of Cascade in the dispenser, kicks the door up and closed, cranks the k

Kale sits on his bed, staring into space. He eyes the clo Tick tick tick... We hear KIDS PLAYING IN THE STREET O.S. Kale glances out the window. HIS POV - Kids on bikes, NEIGHBORS out on walks... ahh... the sights and sounds of summer... And Kale's not invited He glares down at his ankle bracelet. It glares back.
Kale sits on the floor as he spreads a line of Elmer's gl across the bottom of a Twinkie. He's just completed the first couple of floors of what will be... TWINKIE TOWER.
Kale, on cell, sits in his video game chair painting his nails.
(into phone as needed) Dammit, Ronnie, I'm losing my mind.
Give me some details, what's happening out there?

(phone filter; party sounds in the b.g.) Dude, the chicks here in Oahu rock the houusse! Oh my god, this one is totally showing me her kite board. Belay that, she wasn't pointing at me. Look, Kale, I've gotta hop --
Wait, Ronnie -- Hello?

Kale tosses the phone and the nail polish aside. Sits the in silence for a beat. Then eyes a racketball on the floo Picks it up. Starts mindlessly bouncing it against the wall... and keeps bouncing it... and keeps bouncing it...

Kale reclines in his chair, now FURIOUSLY SWATTING the racketball against the wall -- with a racket. We PULL BAC to reveal SCUFF MARKS on the walls and CEILING where Kale has figured out the exact points to hit it allowing him t bounce the ball off multiple walls and return it perfectl to his hand. He SWATS it... and SWATS it...
Kale's passed out in his chair, the racket still in his h He's about to fall out of the chair when a loud BANG O.S. JOLTS him awake.

Kale goes to the window, tilts his head, trying to see wh the noise is coming from. KALE'S POV - He's able to make out some bits of movement next door, but his VIEW is OBSTRUCTED by the architecture his house. Kale steps back from the window, studies it a beat -- the opens it, slowly sticks his head out. HIS   POV - A U-HAUL TRUCK comes into view. It's backed i the   driveway next door. ALAN NORRIS, 43, appears from i the   truck's cab, carrying a moving box. He hands it dow his   wife, BONNIE, 42, who walks back in the house.

Kale's about to pull his head in when another PERSON come out of the moving truck. She's carrying a box that's obscuring her face as she carefully negotiates the inclin of the moving truck's ramp. But her blonde hair and perfect legs look to be about 17. We'll soon know her as ASHLEY, the Norris' daughter. She reaches the end of the ramp. Bends over to retrieve another smaller box, her back and ass to Kale who stares utter disbelief. Ashley stacks the boxes, picks them up a heads into the house, her face still a mystery. Kale watches her go.   Mesmerized. Suddenly, the DOORBELL RINGS O.S. Kale snaps to, yanks his head back in -- and KERBONGS it on the underside of the window. He drops to t floor.
GODDAMMIT!
Kale staggers to his feet...
More doorbell RINGING.       Kale heads down the stairs t front door.
I'm coming!!
Kale swings the door open to see -- A BURNING PAPER BAG o the welcome mat.
Kale instinctively STOMPS ON IT with his SOCKED FEET!
Oh shit!   Shit water shit!

Kale frantically hops around, looking for a hose, bucket, anything wet -- but the flames are already out. Kale look down, finally realizes this -- but there's another proble his socks are smothered in SLIMY DOG SHIT. We hear GIGGLING O.S. Kale glances up as two neighborhood BRATS on bikes emerge from their hiding place behind a sh across the street. They high five each other.
What a retard!
Kale glares -- then heads down the steps into...
Kale walks briskly, menacingly toward them --
You think that's funny? The Brats grow more concerned, back away as Kale draws cl
What are you gonna do, kill us like your teacher?
Not before I shove this shit up your ass! The brats pedal away. Kale races through the sprinkler, crossing his yard into the far corner of Ashley's, trying cut the Brats off as they race down...
The chase is on.   Kale increases his speed.   Almost cat up to them --
(terrified to Brat #1)
Dude, you said he couldn't leave his house!! Kale overhears, stops cold.   He glances to the ANKLE BRA FLASHING RED LIGHT.
Shit! Kale races back down the street, his shit-stained feet le tracks as he goes. He cuts through Ashley's yard again, yelling at the bracelet all the way--
Turn green turn green turn green... Kale races by ASHLEY'S PARENTS, leaps back into...
He looks at the bracelet. Still FLASHING RED. He hops up and down as the SPRINKLER STREAMS approach him from behin
No, c'mon, I'm way inside, turn green --

He spins back toward the house, runs SMACK into the STREA trips on the sprinkler, falls on his face. Now his foot's tangled in the sprinkler. Spraying water all over him. Kale's foot jiggles the sprinkler free. He then sees the ankle bracelet: GREEN LIGHT.
Yes!   That's what I'm talking about!
He gazes over: ASHLEY'S PARENTS, EACH WITH A MOVING BOX,

head_text.subj: STAND THERE, JAWS DROPPED. BOTH TAKE A NERVOUS STEP BACKW

text: as ASHLEY steps out the front door. Freezes at the sight the sopping wet, shit-and-grass-stained Kale. Kale locks eyes with her. Then smiles and waves.
It's cool, I'm all green.
Then -- SIRENS WAIL. Kale turns to the street: TWO POLICE CARS SCREECH TO A STOP. Kale loses the smile.
(phone filter prelap) Kale, calm down, the officers were probably in the neighborhood already.
ON KALE - pacing, on cell phone, pressing an ice-filled Ziplock back to his head.
(into phone as needed) Okay, fine, but if I'd known --
Kale, first times happen. The officers knew that. But next time they will take you to jail.
Kale flips the phone shut, collapses to the bed -- PRELAP - The doorbell RINGS.
Kale, his Louisville Slugger firmly in hand, groggily hea to the door, swings it open. COURIER. With papers.
Hi, I'm from McNeill-Stewart law firm, dropping off for Ms. Julie --
Over this, Kale yanks the envelope away, SLAMS the door i the guy's face. Kale heads away. The doorbell RINGS.
Kale opens the door, grabs the courier's clipboard, signs his name, SLAMS THE DOOR EVEN HARDER.

ON KALE'S FEET - entering frame, inching their way throug the yard... ON THE BRACELET - The green light suddenly goes out, red light FLASHES. Kale's foot quickly steps back. GREEN LIGH A beat, then -- A SMILING GARDEN GNOME SLAMS DOWN INTO FRAME. WIDER - Kale ties kite string around the gnome's hat, the unspools it across the yard to a waiting croquet mallet already hammered into the ground. He pulls the string tau and ties it off. We PULL BACK to REVEAL Kale's emerging KITE STRING PERIME a crude SEMI-CIRCULAR ARC around the yard tied off at different points using makeshift "stakes" -- gnomes, mall shovels, screwdrivers...

Same "BOUNDARY CONSTRUCTION" here. Kale shoves a screwdri into the ground a few feet shy of his mailbox. He ties so string to it as he glances over to the other neighbors' ( PILCH's) yard, sees their black Labra-doodle watching him
Hey doggie, come here...
The dog trots toward Kale. It almost reaches his outstret hand when it suddenly gets ZAPPED by the underground elec fence. It YELPS away. Spins back around, sits and stares.
(re: his ankle bracelet) Hey, you and me both.

head_text.subj: OVER KALE'S SHOULDER IN THE B.G.

text: lifts more boxes from the back of their station wagon. Sh sets them on the drive, SLAMS the liftgate. Kale turns around. Ashley throws him a quick glance, then heads arou the back of her house. Kale stares after her.
CU - The doorknob. Kale's hand enters frame, slowly turns it. Click. Kale pushes.
Kale stands in the doorway. He takes a moment, considerin what he's about to do. Then -- HIS FOOT steps inside. He goes to the window, gently pulls the blind up to reveal t

He peers down, sees Ashley and her mom standing by the swimming pool. Ashley disappears through the back door. Kale tilts his head up, curiously gazing through the pair OPEN WINDOWS on the SECOND FLOOR of Ashley's house.

enters the room. Digging clothes from boxes, stuffing the in her dresser, then -- she pulls her hair back, yanks of her t-shirt, revealing a black bra. (hula dancing)

Aloooha Senor Ka-- Dude, you look like hell. REVERSE ANGLE TO REVEAL KALE - now with a patchy stubble, wearing a bathrobe and a SHRUNKEN t-shirt that used to be white but is now LIGHT PINK. He holds his bat in one hand quart of Haagen Dazs in the other. He smiles, hugs Ronnie Tight -- and not letting go --
Kale leads Ronnie up the stairs and to the window...
Seriously man, you need some sun.
(re: DV cam) Hey, I've gotta show you this.    Maui chicks rule.
(anxious) I've got something to show you, too. (then; slightly crazed) I mean... there's such structure to it, so many layers, but it's invisible if you're not looking close enough...
What are you talking about?
The world right outside the window.
Kale gestures out the window.       Ronnie looks out. The down to the Pilch's backyard.       A Ford Escort is in t Besides that, all's quiet.
-- Fascinating.
(eyeing his watch) Just wait... and... (then) Three... two... one... dog...
The Pilch's dog darts out the back door -- then --
...Mrs. Pilch... saying goodbye to Lonnie...
Husband?
(shaking a "no") Maid.
Over the above, Mrs. Pilch, wearing an unflattering tenni skirt, exits the house. The dog hops around her as she wa back to her heavy set, male maid, LONNIE, 35.
Four o'clock every Thursday, she goes to the country club to play tennis with Betty Big-Bangs there.

Kale and Ronnie watch as Mrs. Pilch heads down the walkwa meets her rail-thin 50-ish female tennis PARTNER at the c As they walk away, the dog tries to follow but gets ZAPPE by the electric fence and YELPS back into the house.
And... ladies disappear... cue white Mercedes... Mr. Pilch... arriving from the office...
A white mercedes pulls in the driveway.    MR. PILCH, 63, out, carrying briefcase and flowers.
Great, that still doesn't explain why you're in a bathrobe at four in the afternoon.
(pulls Ronnie closer) Will you just look --
Dude, he's gonna see --
He can't. We don't have any lights on. Plus the angle's sharper from ground level, it only seems like he could see us. I did the math.
Oh, you did the math.
Optical illusion, line-of-sight doesn't apply to the subject.
Kale --
Now tilt your gaze up...

head_text.subj: TILTING UP TO THE PILCH'S BEDROOM

text: WINDOW - Lonnie vacuums as Mr. Pilch enters the room behi him. Mr. Pilch flips off the light switch, cutting the power to the vacuum. Lonnie startles, turns around, sees Pilch standing there with the flowers and a big smile. A beat, then -- Lonnie jumps in Pilch's arms, kissing him passionately.
DAMN!!
Kale slaps his hand over Ronnie's mouth. Ronnie pulls awa reaches in his pocket, yanks out his ASTHMA INHALER and t a hit. Then --
(re: hallway and window) Seal this area off, Kale.
C'mon, there's more.
What, I go to Maui, you become a stalker?
No, stalking's for psychos. These are just simple observations... natural side effects of chronic boredom.
As Kale heads away:
(pleading) Find your passion, Kale.

Kale leads Ronnie to the window. Ronnie takes in the mess in Kale's room -- the scuff marks on the walls, the compl TWINKIE TOWER. He glances to the desk, sees a penciled GEOMETRIC DIAGRAM of Kale's line-of-sight spying theory - shit, Kale wasn't lying -- he did do the math.
(pointing out) So... Robert Giles...

KALE AND RONNIE'S POV - In the yard across from Kale's ba yard, find ROBERT GILES, gassing up his lawnmower in the driveway. He's early 40's, clean-cut, fit, decent looking He closes the garage door via remote, then fires up the m pushes it around the side of his house toward the front y
He's lived there a couple of years, but I've never noticed he mows his lawn every two days.
Huh, I guess he likes his grass short.
Next to him is Judy Thorp. Dude, she freakin' sneaks over to her neighbors' every morning, steals their newspaper, I guess reads it or swipes the coupons, then puts it back before they even wake up.
(sarcastic) No shit? (weirdly eyeing Kale who heads out) People. You never can tell these days.
Kale slowly pushes on the door. It creaks open. Kale tilt his head, listening. Then -- SPLASH!! Kale smiles.
What was that?
Kale leads Ronnie to the window.
Last stop on the tour.
KALE AND RONNIE'S POV - ASHLEY swims underwater the lengt of the pool. She finally surfaces in all her two-piece gl
Oh-- my-- God. Who be she?
They watch as Ashley steps out of the pool, towels off. S pulls her bikini from her butt, lies in the lounge chair.
Don't know.
What's stopping you?!
Off Kale, considering --
ON KALE - now clean-shaven, sitting on the front steps. H eyes his watch, then stretches his neck. Yawns. Then he sees something O.S.

KALE'S POV - peering down the street, Ashley's stationwag rounds the corner -- Kale hops to his feet, quickly fixes his hair as the stationwagon draws closer. Kale casually strides into the yard, approaching the kite string boundary and mailbox. Then -- keeping his feet pla in what looks to be a very practiced maneuver, he suddenl falls forward against the mailbox. Reaches around with hi free hand, opens the door, going to grab the mail inside just as

pulls the car into and up the drive.    She glances at Ka who nods and smiles back. As the stationwagon heads up the driveway, Kale tries to push himself upright -- but his feet SLIP. He pitches for more. He glances back over his shoulder, sees Ashley gett out of the car and looking his way. Kale struggles under his own weight, trying to keep his feet from crossing the line -- he looks back to Ashley who's now heading toward him. A slight smile crosses Kale's face as --
Can I help you?
Nope, no I'm fine.
(helping him up) Too late.
Thanks, that was really humiliating.
Ashley reaches in the box, grabs the mail, hands it over.
Please. I think any pride you had left was gone a while ago.
Oh, you mean that thing with the cops? They had the wrong guy, total foul up. I'm Kale by the way.
Ashley nods with a semi-polite smile, starts to head away
Hey, so -- how'd the move go?
Still going.
I'd help, but... (re: ankle bracelet) I'm a little spatially challenged at the moment.
Ashley walks closer to Kale, checks out his ankle bracele
Yeah, you've kinda got the whole Martha Stewart thing going on --
(nodding) But minus the 48-hour allowance for office visits. And no lame "Apprentice" spin-off. (off her laugh) So where'd you move from?
I'm a city girl. Born, raised, and now... (glances around; sighs) Forcefully relocated.
That doesn't sound good.
I'm telling you, if I have another clueless jock hit on me or one more soccer mom cuts me off in her oversize SUV, I'm gonna go postal.
Oh, sorry, I was just gonna see if you wanted to hop in my Hummer and cruise to a kegger. (turning away) Nice talking to you.
(cracking a smile) Wait, I --
(from inside house) Ashley? Can you come in here, please?
(quietly to Kale) My mom -- she's very polite, always says "please" but she's got that tone, did you notice?
I know the tone.
(heading away) Oh, I'm Ashley --
Noticed that, too.
Ashley smiles, disappears inside.    Kale's in love.
The wind HOWLS outside. Kale sits on the couch flipping channels. Julie's in the chair, nodding off. ON THE TV - Kale lands on that same photo of PATRICIA WAL the MISSING REDHEAD we saw earlier.

...attended a friend's birthday party at a local nightclub before she was last seen alone at a diner outside Madison, 50 miles east of here. A waitress said Ms. Walsh was picked up around 10:30 P.M. by an unidentified person driving a black 1960's era Mustang that was dented on the left side and may have --

Kale CLICKS the TV off -- looks over to Julie who's now s asleep. Kale's watch ALARM suddenly BEEPS. He quickly shu it off, eyes Julie. She stirs but doesn't wake up. Kale quietly gets up, grabs the blanket off the sofa, cov Julie up. He then picks up his soda and bowl of popcorn from the coffee table, heads away...
Kale, immersed in shadow, enters. He quietly pulls Dad's leather chair toward the window, positions it just right, and sits. KALE'S POV - Ashley's working out to a YOGA DVD.
(to Ashley) You started without me?
As if eerily on cue, Ashley suddenly stops.
What are you stopping for?
She goes to her window and peers out -- Kale ducks -- He looks back up, sees Ashley gazing in his direction -- Kal breathing intensifies -- could she actually be seeing him
(convincing himself) No --
ASHLEY turns around, goes back to her yoga mat. She takes breath, getting back in "the zone," then -- she slowly ra her arms and bends into a ridiculously sexy pose.
Whoa.

Kale watches Ashley another couple of beats. Then her dad appears in the doorway. Looking pissed. Kale leans closer Ashley stops the DVD. From her body language, she's clear annoyed at the interruption. The scene quickly devolves into a heated argument. But Ashley's dad gets the last wo in and leaves. Ashley SLAMS the door behind him, flips of the TV, storms in the bathroom and SLAMS that door, too. Kale watches the vacant room... waiting... another beat, then -- Ashley emerges from the bathroom with a box of tissues. She sits on her bed, pulls THREE TISSUES from th box, staring off... From this angle, it almost looks as i her eyes could meet Kale's at any moment. Kale instinctiv lowers himself in the chair, his eyes never leaving her.. Then -- with a huge gust of HOWLING WIND we
Kale SNAPS AWAKE. Breathing hard. Bad dream. He sits up, peers across to Ashley's windows. Dark, shades pulled. Kale pulls himself out of the chair...
Kale enters, grabs his PSP and falls back to the bed. As starts playing, HEADLIGHT BEAMS appear from O.S. He glanc out the window:
KALE'S POV - A BLACK 1965 MUSTANG CONVERTIBLE pulls in Gi driveway. Kale goes back to playing the PSP, then suddenly stops --
(realizing) -- Mustang --

Kale hops up, heads to the window -- KALE'S POV - Kale watches as Giles hops out, leaves the c running as he heads inside the house. After a beat, the MAIN GARAGE DOOR raises up. Giles appea ducking underneath, heads back to the Mustang, gets in. Giles maneuvers the car around the driveway. The front en of the car swings around, revealing a bashed-in right fro fender.
Holy shit.   A dent --

Kale races to his closet, pulls down a pair of binoculars heads back to the window. BINOCULAR POV - In the garage, Giles is already out of th car, rounding the back as the garage door lowers... Kale crouches, trying to see under the CLOSING DOOR... catchin glimpse of Giles popping the trunk --
suddenly enters frame, lands on Kale's shoulder! Kale SCREAMS, whips around -- Julie. She SCREAMS, too.
Jesus, mom!                       Christ, Kale!
I'm sorry.   I thought you heard me...
What?   No, I --
What's going on?
Nothing, just watching the wind blow.
(re: binoculars) Anything else?
Kale turns back. HIS POV -    Giles' garage door is now closed.
No, see for yourself.
(beat; then) That's okay, I just... wanted to say good night.
Julie leaves.    Kale turns back to the window, stares ou Giles' house.    The lights go out.

ON KALE - sitting in the leather chair, binoculars raised On the floor next to the chair is a 7-11 bag, a slurpee c a bag of beef jerky and an AUTOMOTIVE MAGAZINE with a MUS on the cover. BINOCULAR POV - Ashley sits on the roof leaning against h closed window. She's reading Lolita.
So you don't know what year the Mustang is?
REVEAL RONNIE - sitting at dad's computer looking at the FBI'S OFFICIAL WEBSITE.
(now flipping through magazine) '65 or '66, couldn't tell.
Check this out. The feds think your missing girl might be related to three murders in Austin. All redheads.

Kale processes that as we suddenly hear a car door SLAM O BINOCULAR POV - Kale TILTS DOWN to see Ashley's mom backi out the driveway. Kale TILTS UP to Ashley's window -- Ash ducks back inside her room, disappears.
Movement.
BINOCULAR POV - Kale TILTS DOWN to the pool, sees Ashley emerging from the house with a towel that she throws on t lounge chair.
Better late than never.
Ronnie joins Kale at the window. THEIR POV - Ashley flips her sandals off one at a time, p her tank off revealing her bronzed back and bikini top.
Dude...
Ashley slinks out of her shorts revealing a "near-thong" bikini this time.
DUDE!!
(re: bikini) That's definitely new.
Ashley crouches down, runs her fingers through the water.
Oh, it's so warm, baby...
Ashley cups her hands, scoops a handful of water from the pool, splashes her face... runs her hands through her hai She stands, takes a deep breath, holds it -- then exhales
Cleansing breath...
Ashley stretches her arms high above her head.
Concentrate now. This is for the gold.

Ronnie grabs the binoculars from Kale, puts them to his e moves closer to the window -- but his zoomed-in vision ca him to underestimate the distance -- THWUMP. The end of t binoculars HIT THE WINDOW just as Ashley dives into the p Ronnie and Kale hit the deck as we hear the splash O.S.
Jackass!
Dude, there's no way she heard that.
Dick, my deaf aunt in Omaha heard that.
Kale grabs the binoculars from Ronnie. BINOCULAR POV - Ashley's underwater at the far end of the pool. She tucks and pushes off the wall, swims back...
(peering out) She's got great lung capacity.

ON ASHLEY - She suddenly surfaces, hoists herself from th water. She spins and sits on the ledge, rings the water from her hair. But she suddenly stops -- and shifts her GAZE UP toward Kale and Ronnie!
(pulling Ronnie down) I think she saw me --
There's no way --
Ronnie grabs the binoculars back.
(re: Ashley O.S.) Okay, maybe she did.
Seriously?
Kale peeks out -- THEIR POV - Ashley's slipping back into her shorts and ta top. She heads to the back door, tries the knob. Locked. Over this, Ronnie turns to Kale:
Her swims always that short?
(growing concern) No, she usually takes her time --
They turn back.     Ashley's gone.

The DOORBELL RINGS.       Kale and Ronnie freeze.   Then
KALE                               RONNIE
No.                                  No.

I have to.
Kale peeps through the peephole -- DISTORTED PEEPHOLE POV - Ashley. Kale calmly turns to Ronnie.
What?!   What?! Speak.
It's her.
You're full of --
Ronnie tip-toes to the door. One look at Ashley and he co his mouth, grabs Kale and pulls him back.
Shit shit!!    Oh my shit!
Both laugh, giggle, acting "girlie," practically spinning circles as they speak in hushed, panicked whispers:
She totally saw us --

We are so busted. Don't answer it!
(re: his bracelet) Dude, she knows I'm here.
Kale swings the door open.     Ashley stands there a beat arms folded. Then --
What took you so long? (eyeing Ronnie in b.g.) The house isn't that big.
Yeah, no, we were playing upstairs --
Ronnie cringes at how that sounded.
(covering) Video games...?
(awkward beat; then) So... what brings you here.
Oh.   -- Locked out.
Do you need to call anyone?
Thanks, but I'd rather stay stranded if you don't mind.
Kale and Ronnie trade glances.
May I?
Uh, sure, come on in --
Ashley steps inside, glances around, checking out the pla

Nice to meet you. Video games, huh? (then suggestively to Kale) I like to play.
Kale trades a look with Ronnie as Ashley nonchalantly hea up the stairs.
Excuse me...

A little?
Kale keeps gathering clothes, tossing them to Ronnie who tosses them in the closet. Ashley picks up the binoculars from the window sill, peer outside.

Are you spying on the neighbors, Kale?

(stepping in) Actually, he is.

Is that so.

Exhibit A, Robert Giles.
Yeah, I've seen him.   So?
So you hear about that missing girl from Madison?
(realizing; then pointing out to Giles') What, you think he --
He drives a car like the one she was seen in.
Black Mustang.
60's era Mustang.

They said it was dented.     His has a bashed-in fender.
(re: binoculars) So this is why -- you're --
Suddenly seeing something O.S., Kale RIPS the binoculars of Ashley's hand, goes to the window.

Hey --

The one with no dent?
(grabbing the binocs) What?

How'd he fix it so fast --
Because it was never there in the first place?
Kale eyes Ashley. Shit, could he have imagined it? playfully grabs the binoculars back from Kale. BINOCULAR POV - Ashley catches a glimpse of a faded TEXAS LONGHORNS BUMPER STICKER.
Sorry guys, no bashed-in fender, just a Longhorns bumper sticker.
(grabbing the binocs) You serious? (then to Ronnie) She's right.
THEIR POV - Giles' garage door finally SLAMS CLOSED.
(off Ashley's questioning look) They think it might be linked to some murders in Texas two years ago.
Austin, Texas. Texas Longhorns.
Kale and Ronnie eye Ashley as if to say "see?"      Ashle them another beat -- then:
Okay, fine, stakeout. (grabs binoculars) Who's on my shift?
Off Kale and Ronnie, their dreams realized --
A BOX OF SPYING CRAP is dumped onto Kale's bed. Another D Camera, an old, bulky VHS camera, a black and white porta TV, couple of tri-pods, walkie talkies, wires... a real m

The summary lists four main criteria. Our guy meets at least three. White male between the age of twenty-five and fifty. He doesn't have any pets, right?
Not that I've seen --
You said he lives alone --
What's the fourth?
(nonchalant)
Sexual dysfunction.
Silence. Kale and Ronnie trade awkward glances, shaking their heads to each other as if reassuring themselves the don't suffer from such a condition.
(changing the subject) I'm hungry, let's order pizza.

TRACKING ACROSS KALE'S ROOM - The two tri-pod-mounted DV Cams stand watch over Giles' house. One camera feeds a gr close-up shot of Giles' garage door to Ronnie's portable on the floor. The other feeds a WIDE SHOT of Giles' entir house to Kale's color TV. Both images appear on Kale's computer monitor. WIDER TO REVEAL - Kale and Ashley sit on the floor near t window. Ronnie' passed out on Kale's bed, his hand resting inside the piz box just inches from the last slice.

ON ASHLEY - she's messing with Kale's cell phone.
(handing him his cell) Here.

I'm crafty like that.
What'd you do?
