Every time he calls, that's what you'll hear.
Kale laughs as Ashley delicately re-clips the phone to Ronnie's belt. KALE'S POV - the Pilch's dog, wearing a pink sweater, sud darts into Kale's yard.
What the hell?
THEIR POV - Pilch's dog stops, spins around and takes a d
Where's --
Mr. Pilch, in his robe, suddenly appears from the shadows watches the dog do its business.
(re: Mr. Pilch) Three to one he doesn't pick it up.
Nope. The dog finishes.      Pilch calls it over, scoops dog and heads O.S.
So that's why the grass is greener...
Only in disturbia...
So why the move?
What do you mean? The greener grass, the safer pastures...
No, seriously.
There's a beat as Ashley locks eyes with Kale.       Then

Well, I guess my mom thought it'd help keep dad on a shorter leash. City life... had its temptations... (beat; then matter of fact) But my mom pretty much cries just as much as she always did, and dad doesn't care -- more than ever.
What did they think, an extra bathroom and two-car garage would actually change things... somehow protect them and you from all that crap you can never escape?
Ashley holds Kale's gaze for a beat.      Then, she nods,
Something like that. (eyeing the bracelet) So... what're your issues, Kale?

Kale hesitates. We see in his eyes that he's flashing to the past... "going there..." There's an uneasy beat as As picks up on it: Then -- HEADLIGHTS APPEAR OUTSIDE. Kale quickly turns awa from Ashley, pulls one of the DV Cams off its tri-pod, fl out the three-inch LCD SCREEN.
That's him.
DV CAM POV - Giles' silver Toyota pulls in the driveway. Stops. Engine and headlights turn off.
Another car --

DV CAM POV - Kale ZOOMS IN. The GRAINY IMAGE finally stea to reveal a SECOND CAR pulling in behind Giles. A thirty- something attractive WOMAN -- a REDHEAD -- is at the whee She pulls in next to Giles' car.
You seen her before?
No.
DV CAM POV - Giles gets out.      Wearing a suit, no tie.
(re: Giles) Cute for a killer.
Giles goes to the woman's car, opens her door.
Who said chivalry's dead?
The woman gets out, wearing a black cocktail dress.
There's a club girl for you.
How do you know?
Bright green bracelet's "The Pyramids," purple's "Club 360," the big black stamp's from "Flavor."
DV CAM POV - Kale ZOOMS in on the woman's wrist and hand. Sure enough, she's wearing both a green and a purple brac and has a black stamp blotch on her hand.
(over the above) Missing girl was seen at a club. Didn't say which one though... (then aside to Ashley) Your I.D. must be pretty good.
(with a smile) I don't need one.

They turn back to the window, watch as Giles escorts the woman to the house, shows her in. A light comes on inside DV CAM POV - Kale ZOOMS IN on one of the living room wind spots the woman moving around inside, looking at artwork. she sits on the sofa as Giles enters with two glasses and bottle of wine. He sits down, pours the wine. They toast, take sips. Giles moves in for a kiss --
He's going in.
DV CAM POV - The woman shies away from Giles, stands from the sofa.
Denied...
They watch as the woman gets up, moves to the center of t room, and starts to get a little groove on...
(been there, done that) Oh no, he put on music...
DV CAM POV - Giles watches the woman as she seductively m her body to the music we're not hearing.
Oh, c'mon, Giles, all she wants to do is dance.
What do you think they're listening to?
Could be radio. See if you can find the station.
Kale sets the camera down, turns on his receiver. As he toggles through radio stations -- Rock, Alternative...
(watching the woman & Giles) No... no...
Kale flips to an easy listening R & B station playing Lou Rawls "You'll Never Find Another Love Like Mine."
Stop.
BINOCULAR POV - Ashley watches as Giles takes the woman's hand and dances with her. Their rhythm fits the music perfectly. ON RONNIE - he stirs on the bed, still asleep.
(eyes closed; grinning re: music) Hmmm...

Ashley and Kale eye Ronnie for a beat.     Then turn back the window. DV CAM POV - Kale pans back to the woman and Giles. They' really dancing close now. Kale's and Ashley's eyes shift each other, then quickly flick away. A beat. Then -- Ashl raises the binoculars, faces back toward Giles' with:
Now's the time to bust your move.
Ashley glances to Kale. Kale turns, holds her gaze. A palpable tension between these two. They ever so slowly lean toward each other when -- RONNIE - suddenly interrupts, pushing himself between the
(yawning; re: woman with Giles) Who's that?
Ronnie looks to Kale and Ashley who glare back.
(realizing) Ookay, just fill me in later. (taking Ashley's hand) A pleasure. (then; aside to Kale, mouths; re: Ashley) Duude! (slaps Kale's hand) Later.

Ronnie stands, leaves. Kale shakes his head, turns back t Ashley. They lean in again when -- Ashley's CELL PHONE ominously RINGS with the first measures of BEETHOVEN'S 5T "BUM BUM BUM BUMMMMM." She pulls the cell from her pocket
(re: cell) It's my mom. (into cell) Hi. No, I'm fine. (with a smile) I'm at Barnes and Noble.    Okay, I'm leaving. No, I'll walk.

Ashley flips the phone shut, joins Kale who's watching th LCD screen: DV CAM POV - Giles and the woman are back on the couch. T woman is leaning her head on Giles' shoulder. As Giles le forward to take her wine glass, the woman falls over behi him. Out cold. Kale and Ashley cringe.
And she's down for the count.
Kale and Ashley cross the yard to Kale's kite string boun
Looks like this is as far as you go.
Looks like.
They peer into each other's eyes.       Then --
Y'know, I have to admit, you're different than I expected.
What were you expecting?
I thought you'd be more messed up.
Does that disappoint you? 'Cause I can be more messed up if you want me to.
No, you're fine.
"Fine?"
Yeah.
"Fine" like your first cousin "fine" or "fine" in kind of a Brad Pitt sorta way?

Ashley smiles. They suddenly hear VOICES O.S.       Kale Ashley glance over to Giles' house. THEIR POV - The woman is heading briskly to her car. is right behind her. Ashley grabs Kale's arm and pulls him behind a shrub on h side of the boundary. They peek back over to Giles'. THEIR POV - We're crouched low now, so we only hear the b audible voices of Giles and the WOMAN. Talking SERIOUSLY about something --
(voice raising) Just come back in the house, you shouldn't drive --
He wants her to come back in --
I can't hear --
Let's get closer --
Ashley suddenly darts from behind the shrub and bolts tow the fence --
(re: his bracelet) I can't --

But Ashley keeps going. WE FOLLOW BEHIND ASHLEY - She creeps over to the fence, presses up against it, peering through the cracks -- ASHLEY'S POV - We see the dark silhouettes of Giles and t woman -- Ashley shifts her head, straining to listen --
You really should stay.
I just don't think it's a good idea -- (still searching; more frustrated) Where the hell are they?
The woman suddenly drops her purse.       The CONTENTS sp the driveway. ASHLEY'S POV - Giles bends down, picks up her car keys.
Here --
You're in no condition --
Give me my keys.
Sorry.

ASHLEY'S POV - She sees Giles make a motion toward the fe Suddenly, the woman's CAR KEYS WHACK the other side of th fence, then PLOP DOWN underneath it just a couple of feet from Ashley's position! ON ASHLEY - she startles, looks over, sees the keys. ASHLEY'S POV - She looks back toward Giles and the woman. Hears the woman start to LAUGH. Giles, not laughing, purposefully steps toward the woman, takes her arm.
C'mon...
ASHLEY'S POV - The woman relents.   Giles helps her back the house. WITH KALE - He's seeing it all.
(whispering) Ashley, come on...

WITH ASHLEY - she glances down, eyes the car keys sparkli in the moonlight. She scoots toward them as -- WE CRANE UP TO REVEAL - Giles - heading back toward the f ON KALE - seeing this. Kale tries to get Ashley's attention, but she's not looki CU - ASHLEY'S HAND - she reaches for the car keys -- CLOSER - ASHLEY'S FINGERTIPS barely TOUCH them when -- GILES' HAND - suddenly SWOOPS IN from O.S., BRUSHES ASHLE FINGERS just before grabbing the keys and swiping them ba to his side! Somehow Ashley keeps herself from screaming as she YANKS HAND BACK, PRESSES HERSELF AGAINST THE FENCE. She puts he hand over her mouth to silence her own breathing -- KALE'S POV - Giles stands frozen in the shadows behind As WITH ASHLEY - She slowly turns her head, sees Giles throu one of the cracks -- STANDING RIGHT THERE. Ashley starts to slowly SLIIIDE away... when suddenly -- TWIG SNAPS under her foot! Ashley FREEZES. She peers back through the nearest crack. ASHLEY'S POV - searching for Giles -- doesn't see him -- Ashley presses herself even harder against the fence as w TILT UP AND PAN OVER TO REVEAL GILES - peering over the f We can only hope it's tall enough to keep him from lookin down and seeing Ashley. WITH KALE - He's seeing it all. ON GILES - He raises up, standing on his tip toes to get better look down. Shifting his head back and forth. WITH KALE - He ducks behind the shrub, contemplating his next move. He glances down, picks up a large pebble. He pops out and tosses it over into Giles' yard.

We HEAR IT DROPPING through branches, SCATTERING to the g as Kale ducks back behind the shrub, breathing hard. He then peers back out -- HIS POV - Giles lowers back down, turns and heads back to the house. Kale sighs in relief. Waves Ashley the "all clear." Ashle heads back over to Kale, breathless.
(oddly exhilarated) That was intense.
Are you nuts?!
Ashley silences Kale with a finger to his lips. She then leans in, gives him a peck on the cheek and bolts away -- Off Kale, utterly stupefied --

Exhilarated, Kale SLAMS through the office door, binocula in hand. He goes to his chair, sits, taking position... BINOCULAR POV - Ashley walks in, heads straight for the w and draws the blinds. Kale slumps.    Damn.

ON ASHLEY'S WINDOW - shades still drawn. Lights are out now. The wind picks up outside as we PAN TO REVEAL Kale asleep in the leather chair. We suddenly hear GLASS SHATTER O.S. Kale's eyes POP OPEN. He looks around. Did he hear someth or did he dream it -- he pulls himself out of the chair, makes his way to the door, slowly swings it open...
Kale cautiously steps into the hall...
Mom?
No answer.    He heads to...

Kale enters, tosses the binoculars on the desk, throws a glance out the window to Giles' house. Dark. Kale turns t the bed, pulls back the sheets. As Kale unties his shoes, takes off his socks, we notice over his shoulder -- IN THE B.G. - A LIGHT COMES ON IN GILES' LIVING ROOM. ON KALE - not noticing as he strips down to his boxers --

head_text.subj: THE FACE. SHE WALKS AWAY AS GILES STANDS THERE FROZEN.

text: ON KALE - he throws his clothes in the closet, finally tu back and sees -- KALE'S POV - Giles standing in the living room, glaring a the woman.

Dammit. Kale darts to his desk, turns off the light, grabs the binoculars. BINOCULAR POV - Giles and the woman are arguing. The woma paces around the room as Giles stands there. The woman's arms flail about. As she paces back by Giles, he suddenly GRABS HER ARMS.

Shit! Kale watches as the woman yanks herself from his grasp an knocks over the lamp. The BULB shatters on the floor, throwing the living room into total darkness. Kale drops the binoculars and grabs the DV CAM. He fumble with it, flips open the LCD SCREEN. But as he presses the power button, the camera's LAMP suddenly IGNITES, MOMENTA
Kale spins and hits the floor.   He frantically finds the switch, turns off the lamp.

Dumbass dumbass -- Kale stays on the floor, slouched under the window sill f a couple of beats. Then -- he slowly raises up, peers out DV CAM POV - Giles, now alone, has turned on another ligh and is simultaneously picking up pieces of shattered ligh

bulb and wiping some RED LIQUID OFF THE FLOOR...    Could wine... or blood even... Giles wads the towel up, picks up one of the woman's HIGH HEELS lying near the couch. Giles then moves to the stere turns it off, leans down, picks up the woman's OTHER SHOE He flips off the lights, heads out of the room. Kale trades the grainy DV CAM for the binoculars. BINOCULAR POV - Kale PANS ACROSS the lower floor windows Giles' house that's now become eerily still. He TILTS UP the second floor, SLOWLY PANS ACROSS those windows -- Aga nothing.
Okay, so where is she --

BINOCULAR POV - Over the above, Kale SLOWLY PANS BACK ACR THE SAME WINDOWS, comes to the last one and see GILES STA RIGHT BACK AT HIM. Kale spins and dives to the floor, knocking the other cam and tri-pod over.
Oh shit oh shit...

Kale shoves himself against the wall, frozen in terror. H doesn't dare get up. He spots his CELL PHONE -- on the fl a few feet away. He extends his leg out, uses his foot to slowly SLIIIDE the phone toward him. KALE'S TREMBLING HAND reaches for the phone, picks it up Kale's about to flip it open when the PHONE'S LCD SCREEN

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY LIGHTS UP, BLARING MADONNA'S "LIKE A VIRGIN."

text: Kale startles, fumbles the phone -- realizes it's Ronnie, flips the phone open --
(into phone as needed) Ronnie --
(phone filter as needed) Dude, Ashley is ho-ho-hotttt --
Giles totally busted me.
What do you mean, are you sure?
Kale finally musters the courage to peek over the sill -- KALE'S POV - Gile's BACK DOOR is OPEN.
They were arguing --
Who?
Giles and the girl he brought home. They had an argument, he grabbed her --
And then what?
And then -- nothing.
Uh-huh.
Dude, something is going on over there. What if he killed her, too?
Then call your friends at the police department.
A DOOR suddenly SLAMS O.S.
Wait --
What?
A door just slammed.
(in his best sinister "Scream" voice) That's right, Kale, and now I'm coming up to slash your guts out, you little bastard!
Asshole, I'm serious.
I'm not and I'm hanging up.
Just -- wait -- wait till I check the hall --
This as Kale grabs his bat, slowly approaches his door. Ronnie yawns, starts snoring. Kale's hand is about to gra the knob --
BOO!
Goddamn you!!
Kale flips the phone closed, throws it to the bed. He tur back to the door just as IT SUDDENLY PUSHES OPEN, SMACKIN KALE IN THE FOREHEAD! Kale STUMBLES BACK, screams, raises the bat.
Kale, Kale, it's me!!
Kale doesn't immediately drop the bat as he focuses on Ju dressed in her serving uniform, barely visible in the darkness. She flips the light on.
No, don't!
What's going on, who were you talking to?!
Ronnie -- just Ronnie.
Kale falls back to the bed.
I heard the door --
I'm sorry, the wind caught it --
Fine.   Good.     Okay --
Okay then, so... (catching her breath; then) You want anything from the grocery? I'm going in the morning.
Anything caffeinated.

Kale turns back on his side. Julie eyes him a long beat. What to say... she flips off the light, then -- pulls the door closed. ON KALE - eyes wide open, heart racing.    He's gonna nee that caffeine in the morning.
A groggy Kale tugs on the blind, cautiously raises it -- KALE'S POV - GILES' DRIVEWAY - The silver Toyota's gone. The woman's car is still there.
Kale saunters down the stairs....

Kale enters, notices a few full grocery bags on the count and the coffee maker brewing. He opens the fridge, sees a new Mountain Dew twelve-pack. He cracks open the carton, pulls out a can, closes the fridge door revealing GILES - IN THE FLESH, IN KALE'S KITCHEN. Kale JUMPS, drops the can.    It rolls to Giles' feet.
(picking up the can) Whoa, whoa, settle down, slow down. Robert Giles, your neighbor -- (gesturing outside) Behind you?

Kale glares, breathing hard. Giles taps on the top of the dented soda can, hands it to Kale. Kale doesn't take it. Note: Giles' shirt should have BURNT ORANGE somewhere in either in the pattern, stripes, etc...
I know, how did you --
Giles puts the soda on the counter as Julie comes through the kitchen door carrying groceries.
(to Julie) Think I startled him.
(laughs) Oh. Kale, I ran into Mr. Giles at --
Robert...
(smiles) ...At the grocery. I had a flat tire when I came out. We tried to change it, but --
Dad put those security bolts on --
And that adapter thingy that unscrews it ended up stripping it instead --
My fault.
No, it wasn't. You saved my life. (then to Kale) We had it towed to Frank's.
(with attitude) Gee, really lucky you were there.
Just glad I could help. (then; favors Julie) Must be a little difficult when the man of the house is stuck in the house.
Kale reacts to that. There's an awkward silence as Kale's eyes instinctively glance down to the ankle bracelet.
Oh... no, it's okay, we're managing.
Giles steps closer to Kale, bends down to get a closer lo at the ankle bracelet.
I've always been curious about those things, do you mind?
Yeah, I do.
Oh c'mon, Kale. (to Giles) I'm sorry.
No, no.   It's none of my business.
That's right.
Whoa, hey, dude... you seem like a straight hitter. You ask me, whoever they are deserved it.
Kale reacts, surprised at how genuine that sounded.
(stepping in) Okay... I don't think that's the case, and --
I think I'd like to hear his opinion.
And I think I opened my big mouth again. You're absolutely right. (then; heading for the door) I should go.
Wait, what about your coffee?
I popped my Spanish teacher.
Awkward beat.    Giles turns back to Julie:
In that case, cafe con leche, por favor?
(searching bags) Shoot, milk's... still in the car.
Julie heads out the door.       Giles turns to Kale.   An silent beat. Then --
I like your shirt, by the way.    I mean, the color.
Which one?
Oh, the... that dark orange.   Always reminds me of Texas.
Yeah?   You a Longhorns fan, too?
Sure, absolutely. Even though I've never stepped foot in Texas --
Me neither. Had a lot of friends who went there. I stayed in Minnesota till I moved here.
Huh.
So when you say you "popped" your teacher --
Just a black eye.
Phew, just making sure I wasn't living next to some psycho killer. Listen, I get it though. I had plenty of teachers I wanted to just... kill.
Giles quickly adjusts his tone as Julie comes back with a last bag of groceries:
But no matter how hard it is to hold back, the high road's always the better choice.
As Giles says this, he casually sits at the kitchen table Kale eyes him, about to turn and leave, but:
Kale, could you grab the sugar? (to Giles) Sugar?
(favors Kale) Why not.
Kale quickly grabs the jar of sugar from the counter and even thinks to grab a spoon from the drawer. He delivers to Giles as Julie brings the coffee, sits at the table.
Thanks, man.
Kale turns to leave again.
Oh, hey, Kale... (as Kale turns back) Nice to finally meet you.
Off Kale --
(prelap) Oooh. That's creepy.
Ashley sits on the bed. She looks damned good, too. up, lipstick. She's just heard the story from Kale.
I know, he's a total freak, right?
And very vague... did he genuinely mean it was nice meeting you or was he sending you a "sinister message?"
Are you messing with me?
Maybe a little. Did you even notice my hair?
So you think it's all a coincidence. We've got the car --
With the non dent dent --
The bumper sticker, the argument, the staring contest -- And now he's showing up in my kitchen --
Why, because he slashed your mom's tire?
Maybe.
Ashley rolls her eyes.
(pointing out window) Her car hasn't moved.
It's called "the day after," Kale. Nobody moves after a night like that.
Well what if she's really "not moving?" What if she's tied in the dungeon with the other girl, starving to death --
(getting up) Then come up with a rescue plan and get back to me.
You're leaving?
Have to.    Party.
Whose?
Uh, mine?
How is that possible?
Excuse me?
Well, I mean... Sorry, I just didn't think you knew anybody --
I don't, I didn't -- (off Kale's confusion) I met this girl earlier, Minnie Tyco?
Oh my god, "Skinny Psycho?!" I sat next to that bitch in Spanish --
(skipping that one) I told her my parents were outta town --
And now the whole neighborhood's coming.
Look, I'm stuck here. So I figured I can either shut myself in and keep hating it or... try to make the most of it.
Hey, I get it. You don't have to explain.
Kale, you're welcome to come, but --
Kale looks at Ashley, realizes what she's referring to as glances down to the ankle bracelet.
(with attitude) Well, I appreciate the thought. Really.
(returning the tude) Glad to hear it.
Ashley turns to leave.
It's funny, though.
(turning back) What?
I didn't peg you as a conformist.
Ashley glares, furious. She picks up the DV cam and binoculars, approaches Kale, hands them over with:
Try to keep these in your drawers tonight, will ya?
Ashley leaves.      A sullen Kale stares after her --
PRELAP - CROWD WALLA and THWUMPING MUSIC.

Kale sits in the darkness at dad's desk. He's on the phon pressing his other finger to his ear, trying to drown out the NOISE emanating from Ashley's party next door. Kale, on phone, gets Ronnie's VOICE MAIL.
(phone filter) This is Ronnie, leave a message.
Kale slams the phone down, sits there a beat.     JUMP CU - The white pages THWUMP onto the desk.     JUMP CUT: - Kale on the phone:

(into phone) Yeah, I'm calling about the Jeep Cherokee that was brought in with the flat and the stripped lug -- it's ready? Listen, did they have to replace the whole tire -- they patched it? Is there any way to tell if it was slashed or -- But a nail usually acts like its own plug for awhile, doesn't it? I mean it's a really slow leak, it can't flatten a tire in twenty minutes. (beat as Kale listens) -- Yeah, I guess anything's possible.

A ROAR of LAUGHTER O.S. makes Kale jump from his chair. grabs the binoculars, heads to the window. BINOCULAR POV - Kale scans the crowd until he finds Ashle talking with a group of PARTYGOERS. She pretends to liste to one of the guy's stories as she furtively glances towa Kale's window. But it's quick. We can't be a hundred perc sure if it was on purpose.
Wait, what was that? You think I'm watching? Well, I'm not... Nope, I am minding my own business...

BINOCULAR POV - Ashley excuses herself from the group and approaches the drink and food table where MINNIE TYCO (a. "Skinny Psycho") is standing, nitpicking over her snack choices. Ashley hugs her then taps the cute GUY next to h on the shoulder. The guy turns around.
Ashley mouths "Oh my God" like he's some long lost lover. Ashley hugs the surprised guy who wastes no time in huggi her back.
You think I'm buying that?
Kale keeps watching.
I'm not biting --
BINOCULAR POV - Ashley glances up in Kale's direction aga it's more obvious this time as she keeps HUGGING THE GUY.
That's it.
Kale tosses the binoculars, heads out.
Kale SLAMS a ladder up against the roof.

Kale SLAMS a speaker down on the edge of the roof facing Ashley's. Makes sure the speaker wires are securely clamp in place, then unwinds the roll of wire back across the r toward the ladder... JUMP CUT:
Kale runs the wire down the hall...

CU - Kale's hand flips on dad's bookshelf amplifier, CRAN THE VOLUME CONTROL KNOB. CU - Kale's I-POD LCD SCREEN lights up.    His thumb hove over the PLAY button. BINOCULAR POV - Ashley's party comes into focus. Kale presses play. The speaker EXPLODES with the ROAR OF BARRY MANILOW (or AIR SUPPLY). BINOCULAR POV - Ashley's party comes to a grinding halt. Kale PANS AROUND, picks up Ashley again. Glaring. Fire in her eyes as she storms O.S. Kale smiles with perverse
satisfaction as he tilts his head, anticipating the doorb to ring. Another beat, then -- DING DONG.

Kale descends the stairs, maintaining his wicked grin. He opens the door for Ashley, but instead -- gets PELTED WIT BARRAGE OF WATER BALLOONS. Kale stands there, frozen as the two BRATS jump from the bushes, AD LIB MOCKING Kale as they laugh and race away i the shadows. Kale's about to pursue when the sound of a DOOR OPENING O.S. stops him cold. He spins around to see
storming in from the kitchen and marching up the stairs!
Hey!
Kale races back to the stairs.    Ashley increases her sp
Ashley storms down the hall, sees the speaker wires runni into dad's office...

Ashley SLAMS through the door, spots Kale's I-pod, rips i out of its dock. The music stops. She spins around, runs smack into Kale who SWIPES the I-pod out of her hand and SLAMS it back in the dock. The music BLARES. Ashley moves in, but Kale blocks her path. She tries to get around him He stands in her way.
(peering out the window as if shocked by something) Oh my God --
Kale falls for it. He looks. Ashley shoves him out of the way, grabs the I-pod. Kale chases her out into...
Ashley bolts into...
Where she holds the I-pod out the window, stopping Kale i his tracks.
Back off or I'll throw it where you can't follow.
Take it easy, that's sixty gigs of my life.
Even better.
Okay -- okay --
What are you doing?
What are you doing?
I'm trying to enjoy my party. Wait, that's wrong. According to you, I'm trying to conform --
Coulda fooled me.
What does that mean?
Forget --
No, I'm not gonna forget it.
You wanna blend in with that crowd, fine, then stop looking up and trying to get a rise outta me.
(realizing) So you were watching me. Question is for how long? Just tonight?    Or maybe a week? Two weeks? Since I moved in?
Kale tries to respond, but Ashley keeps pressing:
And the whole "my-neighbor's-the- killer" thing. Great cover --
It's not a cover --
Over the above Ashley glances around
So what is it, Kale?   Huh?   What else have you seen?
What else have I seen?
Yeah.   What else?

Okay -- I've seen how you always pull your kleenex from the box in groups of three. Not two, not four, always three. I've seen you're the only one in the world who eats pizza- flavored Pringles. And you never stuff the chips in, you savor each one by dividing it into four precise bites. I didn't know that was even possible. You're also the first girl I've ever seen who spends more time on her roof than in her own house. And what do you do out there? You don't talk on the phone, you don't paint your nails, you read books. Now one would think with the whole numbers thing you've got going on that you'd put them on your shelf alphabetically, but you don't. Your system's much more perfect. The ones you like go on the bottom, the ones you love go in the middle, and the ones you need, the ones you keep going back to... well they go straight to the top next to the dream encyclopedia. You know what all this tells me? You know how things should be. The world according to Ashley. And guess what? It's a very entertaining and beautiful thing. Even when it takes a hit. When you end up in a place like this... when your parents dump their baggage on you, or just... when it seems like those curveballs are never gonna stop -- It sucks, but just so you know -- I get it.

But I've also seen those designer window shades of yours, and guess what? They always go up the next day -- no matter what. And even if no one else has, I've noticed that. And I ain't sorry. The only thing I'll even consider apologizing for is... not dropping the binoculars and telling you this a lot sooner.
A long beat as Ashley peers into Kale's eyes.      She sl steps closer to him:
That was either the creepiest... or the sweetest thing I've ever heard.

Kale leans in and kisses her. They pull away, lock eyes. Then -- Ashley pulls Kale by his soaking wet t-shirt, kis him back even harder. Heavy make-out. Then -- they stumbl back toward the bed out of frame as we hold on Kale's win and Giles' house beyond...

OUR POV - peering down into Ashley's back yard. There's a couple of guys passed out on rafts floating in the pool. SLOWLY PAN to reveal -- KALE - looking tired, his eyes glazed, sitting at dad's computer surfing a website: "BRUTAL KILLINGS IN AUSTIN." ON THE SCREEN - As Kale clicks pages, we see FLASHES of C SCENE PHOTOS from the three murders -- the bodies of the three redheads -- BLOODIED, BRUISED... ON KALE - he doesn't blink as he clicks on ONE PHOTO afte the OTHER. We see a FLASHES of the victims' eyes -- WIDE OPEN, LIFELESS... We suddenly hear laughter O.S. Kale SNAPS TO. He runs a hand through his hair, gets up, moves to the window. HIS POV - ASHLEY'S POOL - a couple of girls GIGGLE as the stand at the edge of the pool pouring beer onto the passe out guys' chests.
Kale quietly enters and shuts the door. He's hiding somet behind his back as he sits on the bed next to a sleeping Ashley. She stirs, opens her eyes, peers up at him, smile
Hey.
Hey... where have you been?
Kale holds up a folded piece of paper, hands it to Ashley She curiously eyes Kale, then takes it, opens it to revea printed-out picture of a long-stem red rose. Ashley smile
If would have gone to the flower shop, but --
I know.
Ashley pulls Kale in for a kiss. She pulls away, falls ba to the bed. Her eyes glance down at Kale's ankle bracelet
So how much longer?
Oh, two months, twelve days, nineteen hours give or take.
A beat as the two peer into each other's eyes.       Then
You know the other night... when you said you thought I'd be more messed up...
...For a guy who killed his teacher.
I didn't kill my --
Shhh. (kisses him again) I know. -- I know.
We get the impression she knows a lot. Kale leans in for another kiss. But this time, as they lock lips, Ashley's eyes shoot open. HER POV - the first hints of daylight out the window.
Oh my God, what time is it?
Three-thirty.
I've gotta go.

Ashley scrambles out of bed for her clothes, getting dres searching for her shirt. Kale spots it behind the bed. As he gets up to retrieve it, he hears a NOISE O.S. Kale pee out the window -- HIS POV - Giles is dragging a HEAVY BLUE PLASTIC BAG down the stairs leading to the garage.
You better see this.

Ashley throws on her shoes, joins Kale at the window. THEIR POV - Giles pulls the bag into the garage next to w we presume is the Mustang that's now been covered with a TARP. (Note: The woman's car is still in the driveway.) Kale grabs the binoculars. BINOCULAR POV - We catch a glimpse of a few CRIMSON RED S on the blue bag as Giles heaves it behind the Mustang.
Look, quick --
What?
Kale gives her the binoculars.      Ashley looks over.
(sarcastic) That's normal.
Giles' GARAGE DOOR CLOSES.
(re: woman's car) Her car... still hasn't moved...
Ashley pauses, peers out the window again.      She can't but be a little concerned. Then --
So what do you wanna do?
Off Kale --
(prelap) You want me to do what?

ON KALE - holding up a UNIVERSAL GARAGE DOOR REMOTE still the package. Ashley and Ronnie are on the bed. Note: Kale is wearing t same clothes he was yesterday, the stubble coming back. Hair more disheveled, eyes a little puffier...
Phase one, steal his code from his opener.
There's more than one phase?
There's only two. Now look, his remote's in the glove compartment of his Toyota. All you have to do is pop it open and read me the switch settings. "On" or "off."
For the later purpose of doing what? Breaking in to his house?
No, not breaking in. We're just talking about having access to his garage so we can go in on our own time - when he's not there - to just... to get a closer look at the car, the bag --
(to Ashley) All this sounds reasonable to you?
I don't know about that, but --
(re: universal remote) This is good up to thirteen digits --
(realizing) How long have you been planning this?
Ronnie eyes Kale with concern.    Kale doesn't answer.
GILES suddenly FIRES UP HIS LAWNMOWER O.S. KALE'S POV - Giles pushes the mower around the side of th house to the front yard.
Look, if we're gonna do this, it's gotta be now. He takes twenty-one minutes average to mow his front yard... you'll be hearing him the whole time...
Ashley grabs the remote.
I'll do it.
No. (beat; then grabbing the remote) It isn't safe. (getting up; macho) Let's do it.
CU - KALE'S CELL PHONE - "LIKE A VIRGIN" suddenly blares. WIDER - Kale flips his cell open, holds it in one hand, b in the other.
(into headset as needed) Yo, you set?
(phone filter as needed; suddenly sounding not so macho) I can't believe I'm doing this.
Let me conference Ashley in. (punches buttons; then) Ashley, you there?
Ten-four.
Nice.
Kale presses "RECORD" on the tri-pod-mounted DV CAM. He peers back out the window. We hear Giles' lawnmower O.S. Both sides of his house are clear.
Okay, Ron -- Green light.
KALE'S POV - OUT HIS WINDOW - RONNIE - suddenly appears f the bottom of frame, keeping low as he darts to the fence Ronnie turns, peers back up to Kale, gives him the thumbs or down.
You're all good.
BINOCULAR POV - Ronnie draws a breath, then very ungracef hops the fence and falls into Giles' yard out of sight.
Oww, shit --
You okay --
What do you think?
BINOCULAR POV - Ronnie scrambles to his feet from behind fence, darts to the driver's side door of Giles' Toyota.
Dude, glove compartment, other side.
Excuse me if I'm used to my mom's import. Can I just try this one while I'm here?
BINOCULAR POV - Ronnie lifts up on the latch.        Lock
Shit.
Ronnie tries the back door.        Locked.
(in Korean) Shit.
BINOCULAR POV - Kale PANS ACROSS to the other side of Gil house. Nothing. He PANS BACK to Ronnie. OUR POV - Over Kale's shoulder, we see Kale is clearly ai his binocs at Ronnie.
But we also see ON THE FAR SIDE OF FRAME GILES' NEIGHBOR

head_text.subj: PULLS HER LAWNMOWER OUT OF HER GARAGE AND ROLLS IT O.S --

text: But Kale isn't seeing this!
They're all gonna be locked --
Well, while you're there, will you just check?
Ronnie goes around the back of the Toyota to the other si He lifts up on the passenger door latch. Bingo.
I'm in.
You see the package?
We see and hear Ronnie, his ass to us, rummaging around t inside of Giles' car.
Oh my God --
What's wrong?
There's like a month-old order of Nachos Bell Grande under the seat. (then) Okay, I found it.
Kale grabs the pencil and notebook.
Whenever you're ready.
Looks like "on, on, on, off, off, on..." No wait, that one was "off."
Just start over.
"On, on, on, off, off, off, on -- "

Ronnie pauses. Kale glances up. Just happens to shift his gaze to the side of Giles' house to see -- KALE'S POV - GILES IS WALKING BACK AROUND with no lawnmow But for some reason we still HEAR A LAWNMOWER.
No, no --
Kale grabs the binoculars.
I'll get it right this time.
Ronnie, he's coming around.
Dude, stop dicking with me, I still hear his --
BINOCULAR POV - Kale WHIP PANS to Giles' neighbor, JUDY T CUTTING HER GRASS, TOO.
(trying to remain calm and succinct) Ronnie, I am not dicking with you. The neighbor is also mowing her lawn and he's going to see you --
(full-on panic) Kale, what do I do?! Where --
GET IN THE CAR!!
KALE'S POV - Ronnie dives in the car just as Giles rounds the corner of the house.
Put the remote back --
I did, I did --
Easy on the door.
Ronnie gently pulls the door shut.
Don't panic, he's coming straight for you --
What?!   Kale, you've gotta get me --
Back seat, NOW!
BINOCULAR POV - Ronnie TUMBLES into the back seat and out sight just as GILES heads for the car.
Ashley --
I'm on it.
(practically crying) Kale, tell my mom --
Shut up, stay down and don't move.
KALE'S POV - Giles opens the passenger door. About to rea in when something distracts him -- Giles pulls himself ou looks over to see
Heading up the driveway. We barely hear her introduce her to Giles. Giles steps around to the front of the car, uneasily shakes her hand.
Ronnie, you're good --
No answer.
Ronnie?

BINOCULAR POV - Kale TILTS BACK TO THE TOYOTA, sees Ronni sneaking out the back seat door on the driver's side as A distracts Giles, pointing up to the trees on the opposite side of the yard. Who knows what they're talking about. Bird-watching perhaps. Whatever it is, it's working.
Ronnie, was that the whole code? Ronnie?
BINOCULAR POV - Kale PANS BACK to Ronnie as he hops the f back into Kale's yard. Kale TILTS BACK UP to Ashley and Giles in the driveway.
(talking to Ashley even though she can't hear) Okay, Ashley, you're good, come on...
Over this, a breathless Ronnie stumbles into the bedroom, joins Kale at the window.
Was that the whole code?
(pissed) Excuse me?
(serious) The code, did you get it?
You've gotta be kidding.
Ronnie and Kale lock eyes for a tense beat.     Then:
(re: something O.S.) No way.
KALE'S POV - THE CLUB GIRL Giles brought home the other n exits the back door and walks up to Ashley and Giles!
(stepping closer) Great, Kale. She lives.

Kale and Ronnie watch as Ashley shakes hands with the clu girl, then throws a quick surprised glance up to Kale and Ronnie. Giles' body language tells us he's ready for Ashl to leave. Ashley gets the hint, shakes his hand, heads ba down the driveway and out of sight. Kale raises the binoculars again, then furiously grabs fo his pad and pencil. BINOCULAR POV - The club girl gets in her car. Giles clos her door, watches as she backs out. Kale TILTS DOWN to he license plate, starts jotting down the number.
What are you doing?
Getting her license number --
Why?
Kale doesn't answer, still trying to get the rest of the number as Ashley enters, eyes Ronnie who gestures to Kale
Okay, case closed.
Try telling Inspector Clouseau that. Now he thinks he needs her license number.
Why, Kale?   It's over.
Kale's starting to get manic:

"Yeah, he seemed like such a normal guy. Sure he kept to himself, but he was always nice to me." That's what they all say. That's what all the neighbors always say -- after the fact. Only after they've caught the guy, after he's killed thirty people --
Ashley and Ronnie trade concerned looks.
Okay, I think we all just need to take a breath.
(heading out) Fine, but what about the bumper sticker, there's still a girl missing, just... what's in the bag? (then from O.S.) Can anyone tell me that?
Off Ronnie and Ashley --
Kale enters, goes to the desk, sits at dad's computer, clicking keys as Ashley and Ronnie enter --
Kale, why are you so --

Ashley and Ronnie stop in their tracks at the MESS. Note: Up till now, the office has been in reasonably good order. But now, it's noticeably different. WIDER - The shades are drawn. Soda cans everywhere... pap are spread on the floor: PRINTED OUT FULL COLOR GRUESOME CRIME SCENE PHOTOS, BLACK & WHITE AUTOPSY PHOTOS of the

murdered redheads... more pictures of the girl who disappeared, PATRICIA WALSH. "MISSING" FLYERS... Over the above, Ronnie leans down, lifts a couple of book out of an Amazon.com box: "Murderer: Tell Tale Signs of a Serial Killer" and "The Shrine of Jeffrey Dahmer" -- the titles Ashley was referencing earlier. Ronnie shows them Ashley who takes a RECEIPT out of a nearby Home Depot box on the page -- SMITH'S UNIVERSAL GARAGE DOOR REMOTE QTY ( $29.99. Ashley and Ronnie turn to Kale. They notice on the wall behind him, hanging next to his Dad's book cover posters, BLACK AND WHITE POSTER-SIZE SATELLITE PHOTO of THE NEIGHBORHOOD. Giles' house is circled and labeled in flourescent ink. Kale finally looks up, notices them look
(re: satellite poster) Ronnie, you've seen this satellite website, right? You can find any location on earth and take a picture --
Yeah, for a small fee --
Kale, what are you doing?
Trying to get to the bottom of this.
(delicately) Kale, right now, it doesn't look that way.
What's it look like?
Like you're determined to turn Giles in to who you think he is.
Not who I think.
(beat; then) I just didn't realize -- you were this --
What, crazy?     Maybe I am.   But maybe I'm right.

It's not about that, it's about -- (beat; then quietly) -- What I see. What Ronnie and I are seeing right now. I see a guy who looks like he hasn't slept in days. (peers at dad's book cover posters) I'm seeing you sitting at your dad's desk --
That gets Kale's attention.

-- Because you lost him before maybe... you ever really knew him. Before the world according to Kale took a hit from that same stuff you were telling me about, remember? All those curveballs? But it's like -- it's like you're still trying to dodge them by forcing pieces together that are never gonna fit... by getting all wrapped up in... (re: mess) This. (beat; then) Obsessing's not gonna "protect you," Kale. It's not gonna make the hurt go away.
Kale locks eyes with Ashley.       A long beat, then --
Are you two gonna help me or not?
Ashley pauses, shocked she hasn't gotten through to Kale. Then --
I want to.
(picks up a stack) Then start looking through these --
That's not what I meant.
(beat; then) Well, this is all I need, so -- I guess I'll see you later.
Ashley and Ronnie trade looks.       Then -- Ashley leave turns back to Kale.
So what's your deal? You hanging out or not?
I would, dude, but -- I've gotta pull it together and -- change my underwear. Catch you later?
Sure.
Ronnie leaves.       Kale sits in silence, his thoughts u

Kale falls back in the leather chair, fighting his emotio trying to keep them in check. He glances out to Ashley's. Dark. He peers around the office -- the articles, the boo his DAD'S PHOTOS... the family portrait of Dad, Mom, and Kale, smiling wide... their lives ahead of them...

In the darkness, find Kale sitting in his video game chai staring out at Giles' house. HIS POV - Giles' garage door is open. Giles' silver Toyot is parked inside next to the Mustang. There's a light or two on inside Giles' house but no signs of movement. Kale throws intermittent glances out the window as he sta to UNSCREW the back of the DV CAM. He lifts the back off, then reaches in a nearby BOX and pulls out a BLUE TOOTH WIRELESS CIRCUIT BOARD. He starts connecting it inside th camera... JUMP CUT: Kale screws the back of the camera on, takes a swig of a soda. There's suddenly fierce KNOCKING at Kale's front do Kale just sits there. Staring ahead. More knocking and DOORBELL RINGING. Kale jumps from his chair, grabs the ba
Kale swings the door open -- nobody's there -- then -- Ro suddenly STEPS INTO FRAME, grabs Kale --
Get off me, man.
Dude -- my cell phone's -- still in his car.
Kale eyes Ronnie a beat.
Kale, did you hear me?
(beat; then) Ronnie, I know you think I'm losing my mind, but... listen, I'll help you get it, I just need you to do one thing.
(shaking his head) Phase two. I knew it.
A SHAKY and grainy VIDEO IMAGE appears on Kale's computer screen. Kale picks up one of Ronnie's old walkie-talkies.
(into walkie talkie as needed) You read?
(walkie talkie filter as needed) Yeah, you got a signal?
ON KALE'S COMPUTER SCREEN - Ronnie suddenly aims THE VIDE CAMERA AT HIS FACE.
Got video, no audio.
Yeah, mic's on the fritz.    How am I looking?
Kale picks up the binoculars. BINOCULAR POV - Giles' garage door is still open.     The light on at the opposite end of the house.
Light on, far end.
I guess it's now or never.    Moving out.
Kale turns back to the computer screen -- RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - His feet dart across the yard -- he TILTS UP -- approaching the fence.
(re: Giles) No movement.
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - Ronnie hops the fence.
First hurdle --

RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - The image goes to SNOW for a split second -- the signal weakening... Kale peers out the window -- BINOCULAR POV - We barely make out Ronnie's silhouette as makes his way toward the garage --
Twenty feet.     Ten feet --
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - Rapidly approaching the back of Gil Toyota.
Garage --
RONNIE'S   DV CAM POV - Very shaky as Ronnie makes his wa the back   seat door -- he takes out a pen light, aims it the door   as his hand enters frame, lifts up on the latc The door   pops open.
Bingo.
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - We see Ronnie's hand feeling around the back seat floor of Giles' car. Kale's CALL WAITING suddenly BEEPS. He looks at the CALLE I.D: ASHLEY. Shit. He has to let it go.
I'm not seeing it --
Stay calm, it's there.
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - Ronnie's hand finally pulls out the cell phone.
I've got it.
BINOCULAR POV - Giles' house.       Still no sign of move
You're still clear, check the bag.
Hang on --

RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - We see Ronnie's hand gently push th door of Giles' Toyota closed. The angle TILTS DOWN -- we' now watching Ronnie's feet as they stride deeper into the garage, walking in between the Toyota and Mustang.
I'm setting the camera on the trunk.
Try to get the plate number of the Mustang and check for dents --
I'm checking the bag first.

RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - Ronnie sets the camera on the trunk the Mustang, aims it perfectly at the BLUE BAG sitting in the corner. We watch with Kale as Ronnie enters frame, crouched low, heading toward the bag. He raises the walki talkie --
It does look like blood -- and hair --
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - We watch as Ronnie kneels down, sta to open the bag. But suddenly, the still POV suddenly STA TO SLOWLY, STEADILY TRACK TO THE LEFT -- And Kale realize
The camera's sliding --
RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - We watch as Ronnie spins and grabs camera.
That was close.
We hear another NOISE O.S.
Oh shit --
Kale looks out --
KALE'S POV - Giles' GARAGE DOOR STARTS TO CLOSE.
Ronnie?
(staticky) -- make it -- interference -- somebody's here --
Ronnie?!

Dead air.    Giles' GARAGE DOOR SLAMS SHUT. RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - We watch as Ronnie picks up the cam aims it at his face. Looking terrified. The camera swings away as we see Ronnie's feet scrambling along the concret floor and then -- they appear to RACE THROUGH A DOORWAY O DIMLY LIT HARDWOOD FLOOR -- making us and Kale realize --
He's in the house -- (into walkie) Ronnie?
Still nothing. RONNIE'S DV CAM POV - Shaky. We catch GLIMPSES OF RONNIE' FEET -- hauling ass down a HALLWAY, ROUNDING A CORNER ONT
What the hell --
ON THE SCREEN - Ronnie suddenly PANS THE CAMERA up to his face as he runs, clearly mouthing "HELP ME!!"
RONNIE!    Shit --
Then -- the camera seems to fall, SLIDING ON THE HARDWOOD FLOOR TOWARD AN OLD BOOKCASE...
Kale jumps up, pacing. Peers out the window to Giles'. No telling what the hell's happening -- or happened -- in th Kale eyes his ankle bracelet.      Green light.   Kale ey bat. Grabs it. Fuck it.
Kale SLAMS out the back door, races across the yard, skip over his kite string boundary -- ON HIS ANKLE BRACELET - Red light FLASHES. WITH KALE - he hops the fence, racing to...
Ronnie?! Kale darts to Giles' back door, tries the knob -- locked.
Ronnie, can you hear me?! Giles, open the door!! The house is still. Kale bolts around the side, uneasily feeling his way through shadows and low-hanging branches.

It's even darker on this side. No lights on in Giles' hou Kale cautiously rounds the side, approaches the front doo it's open a few inches -- darkness beyond. Kale eyes it a beat. Then -- steps up onto the porch, abo to push it open when -- SIRENS BLARE O.S. Kale SPINS AROUND to see A POLICE CRUISER ROLLING TO A ST Kale races toward it as two uniformed officers step out -
Hey! The officer pulls his sidearm, aims it at Kale --
Freeze.    Hands above your head, now!!
Please, my friend's been kidnapped, he's in this house -- he's inside, I think the owner's trying to kill him --
Stay right there.
I've got it -- Uniform #2 heads briskly to Giles' front door.
(into radio mic) Dispatch, 13A74, we're 10-26 with the kid, he's claiming a 10-31 at... (eying numbers above Giles' door) 4710 Fairway Court. House behind his residence, request 10-78.
(over mic) 13A74, ten-four, units already in the area, will advise --
Kale watches as Uniform #2 approaches the Giles' door.
It's open.
It was already open.
Uniform #2 knocks on the door. Rings the bell. No answer. Uniform #2's about to knock again when a light comes on inside. After a beat -- Giles opens the door. Looking disheveled, in his bathrobe.
Uh, yes, can I help you, officer?
Sorry to wake you, sir, we have a young man here claiming a friend of his is in your house. Would you know anything about that?
(laughs) No, I certainly wouldn't.
You're a lying son of a bitch!
Uniform #1 retrains Kale as another CRUISER rolls to a st Uniforms #3 & 4 hop out, head to Uniform #1 to assist.
Take it easy --
He's in there, goddammit!   He's inside! He's lying!
Uniform #1 pulls Kale back to the cruiser, opens the back door and pushes him down on the seat --
Sir, calm down --

Okay, but he's lying -- he has my friend, and he kidnapped that girl last week, he killed maybe three others, all redheads, they could be in a bag -- a big blue plastic bag -- in his garage -- my friend knew this -- (re: Giles) That's why he's covering -- he didn't just wake up five minutes ago --
Uniform #1 looks concerned as he steps away from Kale.
(to Uniform #3; re: Kale) Can you --
Uniform #3 nods as Uniform #1 heads back up to Giles and Uniform #2. KALE'S POV - Uniform #1 whispers something to Uniform #2. They turn back to Giles.
Sir, do you mind if we take a look inside?
A beat. A couple more police cruisers roll to a stop. Curious NEIGHBORS are now gathering across the street.
Absolutely, be my guest.

Giles ushers them through the door and follows them into house. Giles turns, shoots a quick glance to Kale before closing the door. ON KALE - all he can do is wait. He shifts his gaze to th gathering neighbors. A few lock eyes with him, shake thei heads. Kale turns back toward the house...
ON THE GARAGE DOOR - as it slowly raises up. WIDER - The uniforms, standing with Kale, wait as the doo opens all the way.

A light comes on inside. Giles and Uniform #1 come out th inner garage door as Uniform #2 Giles drags the BLUE BAG from the garage. Sure enough, there's blood smears and visible strands of matted hair near the top. Uniform #2 unties the bag, pull the sides away. Everyone gathers around, peers inside, th suddenly yank themselves back at the horrible STENCH eman from within. Kale eyes Uniform #1 who gestures him to look.       Kale toward the bag. KALE'S POV - We peer into the bag to reveal the WIDE OPEN eyes of a dead -- DEER.
(to the cops) I hit it the other night. Thought I'd save a few steps and get it off the road myself. I was gonna bury it sooner, but it's been a helluva week --
So why'd you have to have the car fixed in record time, huh? Because it was covered in her blood --
(talking over him; re: Mustang) Because it's a classic, I got it out of storage for the auto show, I needed it in pristine condition.
It's one of the biggest in the world. (off Uniform #1) The auto show.
All eyes on Kale.    He slumps.   Giles has an answer for everything.
I think we're done here.   Sorry for the intrusion, sir.
Please, I understand.
As the Uniforms lead Kale back down the driveway...
(quietly; drained) So where's my friend, then? Can anyone tell me that? Does anyone believe me?!
Kale looks over, sees PARKER, standing with JULIE whose e are filled with it all: anger, concern, sadness...
Kale, come on --

Kale turns back to Giles' house. Sees lights being turned out inside. As Kale shifts his gaze forward, he locks eye with ASHLEY standing in the crowd of neighbors. She watch him with concern. Kale turns away, drops his head as the cops, Parker and Julie lead him away... a FLASH OF LIGHTN in the distance...

Kale sits on the sofa, staring off. He looks to the stair as Julie and Parker head down. Parker nods to Uniform #3 who's standing next to Kale. Uniform #3 meets Parker and Julie at the front door. Julie quietly nods to them, open the door. A few more inaudible words are exchanged before Julie gently closes the door behind them. Julie heads back into the living room, sits across from K
(a beat; then) I'm sorry, Kale.
Not the words Kale expected.      He looks up --
I really am. You know, one thing I always told myself was that no matter what, I would always know what was going on with my kid --
Mom --

Let me finish -- because I have to tell you something... (then) I feel like I let you down. I was too caught up in my own grief to see straight. I thought time would heal this and taking a second job was... the answer to keeping a roof over our heads --
It was --

(points to ceiling) That's just wood. Do you hear me? We're still not through this -- obviously -- it's gonna take more time -- maybe a lot more time -- and that's just gotta be okay, because I know -- it'll get better. (beat) I want us to be us again. I want us to be honest with each other like we used to be. Is that possible?
Yeah. I just -- didn't think you'd believe me --
Listen to me. I am always on your side. No matter what. It may not look like it sometimes, but it's the truth. And we'll get through this. Okay?
Kale nods.    He stands, goes to Julie and hugs her -- ti

Kale enters amidst a few more LIGHTNING FLASHES and dista ROLLS OF THUNDER. He heads to his window, glances out at Giles' house. Dark. The wind's picking up. Kale closes his window, draws the shade, sticks his cell in the charg He collapses to the bed,      stares at the roof over his for a beat -- then "LIKE      A VIRGIN" suddenly BLARES O CELL PHONE. Kale stares       at it... then jumps from hi races to the phone, rips      it from the charger, flips ON THE PHONE'S LCD SCREEN - A text message: LOOK AT YOUR SCREEN. The LCD SCREEN suddenly BLACKS OUT. The battery's dead. A wide eyed Kale puts the cell phone on his desk, slowly shifts his gaze to his computer monitor -- a grainy image suddenly pops on -- shaky at first -- then it finally steadies, and clears up. A torso and face come into focus RONNIE, lying in the corner of a very enclosed space. Eye open, head tilted against the wall. Dead.
OH MY GOD --
Nearly hyperventilating, Kale leans closer to the screen, sees a pile of clothes and a stray racketball trophy lyin next to Ronnie.
Shit --
Kale realizes -- Ronnie's IN HIS CLOSET. Kale slowly turn eyes his closet door. He then steps toward it, reaches ou and SLIDES THE CLOSET DOOR OPEN TO REVEAL -- RONNIE - lying dead in the corner.
Ronnie --
Kale kneels down to Ronnie who suddenly POPS BACK TO LIFE
BOO!
Kale screams, falls back to the floor as Ronnie cracks up MORE LIGHTNING FLASHES and THUNDER. Kale staggers to his feet. Stunned. Not knowing whether t hug Ronnie or beat the shit out of him.
Dude, don't kill me, don't kill me -- I can explain --
How -- How long have you been here?
You should have seen your face -- (off Kale's glare) I got out his front door. I got lucky. I heard you yelling, but dude, cops were everywhere --
Still, you could have --
What, popped out and said, "oh yeah, officers, my friend's right, I was just in that house, I'd gone to get my cell phone out of the guy's car I broke into earlier..." Are you kidding me?
(beat; then) I get it.
Kale paces around, runs a hand through his hair as Ronnie steps out of the closet, DV CAM in hand.
Dude, I am sorry. Can we just... hug it out?
Why didn't Giles tell the cops someone broke in? I mean, he did see you, right?

You know, let's be positive for a change. I thought he did, but maybe he didn't. Or maybe he's a nice guy afterall, and he didn't wanna make a big deal of it, you know? I mean, he's a guy, he was a kid once...
Kale eyes Ronnie.
What if he wasn't always a guy?
Ronnie eyes Kale for a beat, wondering if he's serious. Then Kale cracks a smile. Ronnie cracks up.
But I do have to ask... what was in the bag?
(as if it were obvious) Dead deer.
Kale and Ronnie lock eyes a beat. Then crack up again. Both laugh hysterically, slap happy as hell.
Naturally... (re: DV CAM) Hey, you want more evidence, detective?
I was watching, remember?
Kale grabs the DV CAM from Ronnie -- Ronnie pulls it away
No, no, this is comedy, it deserves big screen treatment.
Ronnie grabs some wires, starts hooking the camera up to Kale's TV.

Kale and Ronnie watch the video of Ronnie's break-in. cracking themselves up as we see -- ON THE TV - Ronnie's feet stumbling through the garage, t camera sliding away off the trunk of the Mustang, Ronnie diving for it.
Hey, I caught that.
So that's when the garage door started closing.
Yeah, he must have heard me. He came through the inside door -- (re: TV screen) This is where I ducked low and started...
ON THE TV - Ronnie's feet start motoring across the concr floor, racing through the doorway onto the hardwood floor
...hauling aaaass...
That's great.

ON THE TV - As before, we're mostly watching Ronnie's fee as they scamper around Giles' house. Then -- the camera falls away, slides across the floor toward that bookcase, its POV -- FOR A SPLIT SECOND - aiming UNDER THE BOOKCASE
Dropped it.
Yeah, I lost signal --
ON THE TV - This we didn't see earlier -- The camera is quickly scooped up by Ronnie whose feet dart across Giles entry hall floor toward the front door.
We see Ronnie's hand reach for the knob.
But I never leave evidence behind.
ON THE TV - Ronnie's feet dart out Giles' front door and into the darkness of the yard...
And that's about when you started yelling bloody murder and the shit hit the fan.
The TV SCREEN goes black.
(getting up) I'm starving. All that running around...
Ronnie heads from the room.
(re: video) I'm gonna burn this.

Kale gets up, heads to the camera. About to eject the tap when a thought stops him. He pulls the camera off the TV, sits on the floor, presses "PLAY", scans back through the tape. ON THE TV - The same footage. Nothing glaring stands out. The camera falls from Ronnie's hand, slides to the bookca Ronnie quickly scoops the camera up, keeps running...
You're not fooling me, Giles...
Kale scans the tape back again, this time just to the poi where Ronnie drops the camera. ON KALE - his eyes suddenly narrow -- did he see somethin Kale scans back again.
Ronnie enters, starts rummaging through the fridge, pulls soda out, then goes for the cabinets.
ON THE TV - just as the camera slides to a stop at the bookcase and aims underneath it, Kale FREEZES THE IMAGE. Dark, grainy.

Kale grabs his remote, cranks the brightness all the way on his TV. Kale scoots closer to the TV amidst another FLASH OF LIGH & MUCH LOUDER CLAP OF THUNDER. ON HIS FINGER - pressing the FRAME BY FRAME ADVANCE butto ON THE TV -- we start to see SOMETHING UNDER THE BOOKCASE Kale presses the button a couple more times. ON THE TV - The next frames are blurred -- this is the po where Ronnie grabs the camera back -- but -- KALE'S FINGER - presses the advance button one more time. ON THE TV - The next frame POPS INTO FOCUS.

head_text.subj: THERE, UNDER THE BOOKCASE, WE SEE A FADED BLACK STAMP ON

text: Kale's eyes widen as he keeps pressing the ADVANCE BUTTON CU - Kale's eyes are transfixed on the screen, his face j inches away as a few more blurry frames FLIP BY then -- B

head_text.subj: THE FACE OF THE MISSING GIRL
THE SCREEN IN SHARP FOCUS, HER LONG RED HAIR PARTIALLY

text: Kale recoils in horror as LIGHTNING IGNITES his room.
(calling O.S.) Ronnie, get your ass up here!
But a ROLL OF THUNDER drowns our Kale's voice --

Ronnie throws a bag of popcorn in the microwave, punches clock. Presses start. As he reaches behind him for his soda can on the island, a BASEBALL BAT suddenly enters fr and SLAMS DOWN on RONNIE'S ARM -- FWACK! Ronnie WHIRLS AR in excruciating pain to come face to face with
who swings the bat across Ronnie's face.     Ronnie drops of frame behind the island.

Ronnie?! No answer. Shit. Kale grabs the cordless off his bed, cli it on: DEAD. Another lightning FLASH. He grabs the tape out of the camera, buries it in his closet, pulls out his racketball trophy then creeps to the door, peers out -- KALE'S POV - The hallway's empty.   Clear shot to the sta
Kale steps out, raises the trophy, ready for anything as approaches the stairs, glancing in every direction. He reaches the railing, peers down. No movement.
Kale heads down, slowly makes his way toward the kitchen, peeks around the corner -- KALE'S POV - IN THE KITCHEN - The popcorn's POPPING in th microwave.
Kale rounds the island to the microwave, presses "STOP" t glances down, sees Ronnie's body --

Ronnie -- MOM!! Kale spins around as GILES SUDDENLY APPEARS FROM THE SHADOWS. More THUNDER. Kale whirls around, HURLS the trophy at Gil Giles knocks it away as Kale BOLTS for the back door, thr it open. Giles pursues.

Kale bolts out the door, but trips on a well-placed garde gnome on the steps. Giles or the brats must have put it there. Regardless, it slows Kale down. He staggers into the yard, SCREAMING for anyone to hear. But the WIND and THUNDER drown him out as
-- Now right behind him -- swings the bat and trips Kale Kale falls just short of his kite string boundary line.

Like a quarterback pressing to the goal line, Kale lunges forward, but -- GILES' HAND suddenly grab's KALE'S ANKLE just as the ANKL BRACELET is about to cross the line. Kale screams, digs his hands into the earth, trying to pu himself forward, but Giles is too strong. He DRAGS Kale backward, then PINS him to the ground, pulls out a roll o duct tape, quickly and efficiently wraps some around Kale mouth, hands and ankles. Giles yanks Kale up, throws him over his shoulder and hea back toward Kale's house.
Giles quickly opens and shuts the door as Kale struggles against him.
(hard in Kale's ear) You finally wanna be an orphan?
Giles drags Kale into...

... To reveal a bruised but conscious JULIE tied to the c her arms wrapped behind it! Kale's eyes widen with rage a he pulls free of Giles, drops to the floor, tries to roll away. But Giles grabs him back up, gets in his face --
If you don't stop fighting me, I will gut her like a fish.
Kale glares as Giles drags him into the...
...And pulls him up the stairs...
Giles SLAMS Kale down in his desk chair. Giles eyes the D CAM sitting on the TV. The tape slot's open.
So where's the tape?
Kale mumbles a muffled "FUCK YOU" under the duct tape.
You're right, I'll find it later.
Giles sits on Kale's bed. Eyes the book on serial killers He picks it up, flips through it.

It's funny, I hear a lot of authors say their first books were easy, it's the second one that's really hard. Wonder if your dad thought that. (off Kale's glare) See with me, it's the opposite. The very first one was... (sickly reminiscing) ...Very difficult... she was very beautiful... fragile... a lot of promise... the others in Texas were flings, low class... Patty Walsh had potential, but so did Amy. You saw her, right? When you were watching me? You should feel good, Kale, you guys saved her life. I was headed in to kill her when your girlfriend showed up. So, you're a hero, Kale. Savor the moment. (tosses the book) You have Microsoft Word? (off Kale's questioning look; re: computer) Turn it on.
Kale doesn't move.    Giles raises the bat:
I can type, you know.
Kale turns to the computer, lifts his taped wrists to the keyboard.

"Dear Ashley... I killed Ronnie and my mom because... (re: Kale not typing) What's wrong? Hey, you're the one who couldn't leave me alone. Truthfully, I'm sick of covering my tracks. You think I like spending my spare time looking over my shoulder for people like you? Word of advice, if you ever need to hurt someone, think everything through. Because you do get a taste for it, don't you?

But damned if people aren't just waiting to stand in your way... cops, reporters, determined relatives, nosy fucking neighbors... next thing you know, you're on tilt, you can't think straight, you're clocking your teacher in front of the whole class, me... I'm hitting a damned deer... Man, that was some shitty luck. (then) Anyway, it's pretty clear how we've gotta clean this up. The irony is, you've done all the hard stuff. Whaddaya think: "Troubled youth finally snapped." Maybe because he was jealous of his girlfriend, or maybe he just couldn't deal with the guilt from not saving daddy. (off Kale) Hey, you Googled me.

Giles steps away, turns back to the bed as Kale suddenly does SNAP. He leans forward, grabs the LCD computer monit with his taped wrists, stands, whirls around, and HURLS i at GILES, SMACKING HIM on the side of his head -- a one i hundred shot! Giles goes down. He HOPS toward Giles, raises the bat, swings it, but Giles anticipates, grabs the bat, pulls it forwar and REVERSE JABS KALE in the face! Kale staggers back, bu somehow keeps his balance and the bat. Ashley shoves Kale inside as she spins back, SLAMS the of door in Giles' face, locks it. Giles BANGS on the door. Ashley goes to Kale, RIPS the duct tape off his mouth. SCREAMS in PAIN as Ashley heads for the desk phone.
It's dead.

Let me try --
Ashley moves in, tries to cut it loose with the scissors Giles suddenly SLAMS SOMETHING against the door, trying t break it down!
Where's your mom --
(tugging on bracelet) Living room -- tied up -- he got Ronnie -- in the kitchen -- (then; re: bracelet) GODDAMN YOU!!
(giving up with scissors) Okay, just -- I'll get your mom, you figure out a way to call the cops --
No, I've gotta get her --
Kale, you've gotta get outside, get over the boundary -- do you hear me?

Ashley and Kale glance around for weapons. Ashley pockets the scissors, grabs a letter opener off dad's desk. Kale finds his racketball racket and the ball. Pockets the bal slips the racket in the back of his shorts, then grabs th baseball bat as he heads for the bookshelves near the doo that leads to the outside porch. Once I have his attention, you go get her.
Ashley nods. Kale takes the key, heads to the porch door, unlocks it with a quiet CLICK. He swings the door open, steps out onto...
Kale raises the bat, swings it at the 2nd floor hallway w that separates the interior of the house from the porch. The window SHATTERS. Kale tosses the bat back to Ashley.
(to Giles O.S.) We're out here, asshole!

There's a lull in the thunder. All becomes eerily quiet f a beat as Kale waits for Giles to appear at the window. H glances back at Ashley who ducks behind the wall inside d office -- she glances to the office door. No more BANGING She shrugs to Kale: "where is he?" Another beat, then suddenly -- a FLASH OF LIGHTNING revea
Standing in the other porch doorway BEHIND KALE!
Kale!
Kale whirls around just as Giles reaches out, grabs him b the throat, pulls him off his feet and HURLS KALE through the shattered window into the hallway!
NO!   You son of a --

Ashley charges out onto the porch with the bat. Swings it at Giles who promptly RIPS it from her hand and hurls it the porch. Ashley whips out the letter opener, spins arou about to stab Giles, but he backhands her. Ashley falls, SMACKS her head on the porch railing.

WHIP PAN to behind Giles -- REVEAL KALE - CHARGING OUT th same porch door Giles just came out! Kale uses his FULL BODY WEIGHT to SHOVE Giles back through the SAME BROKEN W and into the hallway!

I wanna kill him --
Stick to the plan --
Over this, Kale pulls Ashley to her feet. They share a sm as Ashley ducks into the porch door leading to Kale's roo Kale turns back --

Gets to his feet and heads toward the window.   Kale turn for the ladder, starts climbing up. Giles pursues, steps out the window as we see Ashley, in b.g., appear from Kale's bedroom and race for the stairs!

Kale drops the racket. It slides away down the roof as Ka doubles over. But Giles grabs Kale before he can fall. He pulls Kale up off his feet, pulls him closer, gets in his face. Kale summons some strength, tilts his head up and HEADBUTTS GILES. Giles stumbles back, pulling Kale with him. Giles SLAMS down on the roof. He and Kale roll down the incline and stop just short of the edge -- Kale looks over, spots his STEREO SPEAKER a few feet away

Hi, Mrs. Brecht, I'm Ashley -- (re: duct tape) It's gonna hurt.
Julie nods as Ashley RIPS the tape off Julie's mouth.
(not flinching) Where's Kale?

Kale HURLS the speaker at Giles', SMACKING him hard. shakes it off, grabs the speaker wire -- WITH KALE - he gets to his feet, heads back up the roof a Giles suddenly whips out the letter opener and hurls it l a THROWING KNIFE at Kale. The letter opener embeds itself in the back of Kale's thi Kale screams, falls to his knees. CU - Kale cringes from the pain as Giles, now right behin him, wraps the SPEAKER WIRE around Kale's NECK and pulls. Kale grabs for it as Giles chokes the life out of him. Ka only has one chance. KALE'S POV - Giles stands on the upper roof, smiles as he brings up the letter opener. Kale's eyes widen. He pulls himself to his feet, and side the racket up at Giles. The racket spins through the air like a boomerang and miraculously smacks Giles in the han knocking the letter opener away! WITH KALE - he whirls around, races toward the edge of th roof... and JUMPS.

Where's my mom?

What's wrong?

Kale trades Ashley the net for the butcher knife.     We FOLLOW KALE into...

Kale, what's going on now?

Parker, you need to get them here right now -- Giles is --
Evening.

PARKER LOOK OUT, HE'S THE --

But Giles finds an openin and elbows both Ashley and Kale back to the floor. Kale scrambles for the butcher knife back down the entry hall. Giles gets to his feet, pounds after Kale who slides the butcher knife out from under the table. But Giles suddenl STOMPS down on Kale's hand. Giles lifts his foot up. Kale pulls his hand away. Giles kicks the knife away, grabs Kale up, SLAMS him against th staircase banister, splintering it. Kale drops back to the floor. Giles leans down to pick hi up when the BUTT OF A SHOTGUN suddenly SLAMS into the bac of Giles' head! Giles tumbles forward, spins around to se

standing on the staircase with a 12-GAUGE SHOTGUN -- KABO Julie BLOWS GILES BACK INTO THE WALL!   -- And THAT'S WHE HE STAYS. Julie races down to Kale, hugs him tight. Ashley comes to slowly makes her way over and joins the huddle...

...the body of Partricia Walsh, missing since last week, has been recovered along with the remains of at least three other women. Authorities say Giles meticulously maintained his yard, mowing the lawn routinely in order to avoid the formation of sinkholes which could have exposed his terrible secret...
A cleaner-cut Kale sits across from a COUNSELOR.

(beat) He was my best friend. We always talked about what guys talk about... sports, women... food... We were talking about the freakin' fish -- this huge, amazing black bass we'd just caught -- and how we'd be eating it for a week... the next thing I know -- I can't hold on... and he's letting go... I was so pissed at
him, I was so -- he's the one who left, he's the one who gave up, you know? -- But that's b.s. See, the truth is, my dad -- He saved me.
CU - The doorknob.       A hand slowly enters frame. WIDER TO REVEAL Kale and Julie stand outside the door tha now been fixed.
You ready?

Kale and Julie enter with two large boxes, set them on th floor. They both take breaths, then -- start sifting thro dad's things, deciding which items to keep and which to b up... As they carefully consider each one we slowly PULL BACK and
BINOCULAR POV - Giles' house.        The yard's been comp put back together. We are...
CU - KALE intently watches.        Then:
Movement.
Ashley joins him at the window. THEIR POV - Julie, wearing her realtor business suit, wal a YOUNG COUPLE up Giles' driveway and into the back yard.
Why's your mom doing this again?
She's whacked. Plain and simple. I think she thought it'd be some sick challenge or something -- hey, commission's the same I guess...
They watch as Julie points out the yard to the couple. Th couple turns back to the house. Julie suddenly spins arou and gives a quick sotto "thumbs up" to Kale and Ashley!
No way.   She can't be serious.
Hey, if anyone can spin a psycho house into the opportunity of a lifetime, I'd bet on your mom any day of the week.
(re: the couple) Fine, but we still have to seriously question the yayhoos buying the place.
Whaddaya think, another stakeout?
(tossing the binoculars) Screw that. My mom has another half hour over there at least.

Kale pulls Ashley back to the bed. They kiss, but then suddenly stop -- sensing something O.S. They both slowly shift their heads to see -- THEIR POV - Ronnie, with a head bandage, stands in the doorway, aiming his DV camera straight at them.
(don't mind me) I'm not even here.
